loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is 56 years old and married with two children.

Melania works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Melania has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for eight years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Melania aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Davide

texts.en:
Davide is back again and in need for another loan. She wants to invest in an irrigation pump to water the planted field. 

Her region and the village where she resides suffered from severe flooding all these past months; however, the residents hope that from now on the weather will be stable and they will be able to plant even though a bit late this time.

Davide purchased sows with the previous loan "thanks to the lenders," she said, smiling." Without their help, I would not be able to achieve what I achieved, despite my desire to do something. So again, thanks a lot to all of you who supported me and who support people in need like myself," was her last phrase.

loans.use: To buy an irrigation pump.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 57 years old and is married with 6 children.  

Norma is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Norma requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Norma has been farming rice for 15 years now, and has borrowed 27 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Norma would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 47-year-old hardworking woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, three sons and five daughters. Three of her children are currently studying in primary school. Abida's husband is a laborer, but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses.

Abida is a very hardworking and responsible woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband meet the family's needs and her children's educational expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past 15 years, and her clients always appreciate her work.

Abida has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing a new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently in the future and her production could be increased. As she is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams to build her own house. She also desires to expand her business and to provide a quality education to her children. With the profit amount, she will pay her house rent. Abida and her family are very much thankful to both BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Serious Women Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Serious Women group from Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Kadiatu is the featured leader of this group. The 36-year-old is a native of Makonkarie village. She is married to a trader, and they have three children who are attending primary and secondary school. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for many years now; she sells charcoal. With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of charcoal to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of charcoal to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Jecintar

texts.en:
Jecintar is a married mother of three who lives in the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi, Kenya. She currently works as a textile retailer at the nearby Gikomba market. Due to the need for sanitation facilities at the market -- the largest open-air market in the country -- Jecintar would like to purchase two Fresh Life toilets.

Jecintar's main goals are to provide a sanitation solution in the market area and to establish herself as a successful entrepreneur. She intends to use the profits from this business to fund her children's education and buy her own house. Jecintar's dream is to be known as the pioneer of Fresh Life toilets in the Gikomba area.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Remember We Group

texts.en:
Ramatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Ramatu was born 38 years ago in one of the villages that make up Sanda. She is married to a trader and the couple has 3 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Ramatu sells body lotions, soaps, sprays, toothpastes, etc. and has been doing this business for 6 years now.

With the help of this loan, Ramatu and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Ramatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy body lotions, soaps, sprays, toothpastes, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy body lotions, soaps, sprays, toothpastes, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Sadaf Group

texts.en: Sadaf is a 28-year-old, hardworking and diligent woman. Her husband is a video recorder and makes movies for marriages. He has been doing this work for 9 years. He is a very skilled and expert movie maker and his clients are very well satisfied with his work. Currently, he requires a high resolution movie camera to make the best quality movies. For that purpose, Sadaf has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, as a member of 3 person group. Her husband will purchase a new camera so he can do his work with more efficiency in the future. This would also increase the net income and savings. Sadaf is very hopeful for this loan as this could solve many of their financial problems.With the profit amount, Sadaf would pay her household expenses. NOTE: In the picture, Sadaf is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a new movie camera

loans.name: Ozodamo

texts.en:
Ozodamo is a kind and smart woman. Gany is her husband. They have two children they love very much. They live together in a big house.

She sells a variety of children's clothes. She stores her merchandise at the local market. She acquires her goods in shopping centers in the city. She makes periodic trips to accomplish her goal. She began working this way some years ago because she needed to earn money. Currently, her sister helps her to purchase her merchandise.  She is asking for a loan of 2,800 USD to buy children's clothes for new season.

This is her first loan with IMON, and she promises to make payments on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy face powders, facial lotions, bangles, and hair extensions

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 56 years old and single. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Sylvia is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Sylvia has been farming sugarcane for eleven years and also earns additional income from her general store and from fattening pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her extended family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres y hermanos  actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar almacigo de café para sembrarlo en una pequeña ´propiedad de la familia,, el desea dar asistencia a este cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , y así obtener mayores ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida , ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Antonio, an enterprising man, is 33, single, and lives with his parents and siblings at the moment. He is requesting a loan with the desire to buy coffee seedlings to plant on a small plot of family land. He wants to maintain these coffee crops in order to keep them in good condition during their development and obtain a product of good quality. This will earn a higher profit and provide him and his family with a better quality of life. They depend on this work. For this reason, Antonio is requesting a loan. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with greater ease and lower much interest rates.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a lady of 38 years. She is single and a mother of two children. She sells clothes in Limuru. Rose has been in the business for six years, and she gets a monthly income of 10,000 shillings.
 
This will be Rose's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase clothes for sale. She plans to use the profits to pay back the loan and plow back into her business. In the future, she wants to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married. He is a father of one and lives in Kisauni. He services motor vehicles and sells spare parts. John is a very hardworking and enterprising man who says that he has been able to greatly increase his income and help his family, thanks to his hard work.

He always struggles to improve his mechanic workshop, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. John is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy work tools for his mechanics shop in order to do his work efficiently.

loans.use: to buy work tools for his mechanics shop.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda is 50 years old. She is married and has two children who are adults. For some years, she has wanted to organize her own business. Mavluda dedicated herself to realizing her plan. She started a new business selling dried fruits three months ago. She studied at the course of ‘To Get Ahead’ in the women's organization and got enough skills about business. She manages the business alone. She sells her goods at the local market. 

She wants to increase her working capital and develop new business. In this way, she wants to maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy dried fruits. She will use her loan and her business to be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits for developing a new business.

loans.name: Atipashe Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39-year-old Livison from Masvingo. He is married with three children and two are attending school. Livison runs a retail business which sells groceries and plough wheels. The business has been in operation for 16 years. He says the main challenge being faced is that of his debtors failing to pay on time. Livison has requested a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase sugar, cooking oil, mealie meal and maize seed for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable him to improve the welfare of his family. In the future, Livison plans to buy a house in town.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, cooking oil, mealie meal and maize seed

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 14,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita dreams that her business will grow even more and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Zulekha

texts.en: Zulekha is a married mother of three who lives in Kisauni. With the help of her family, she sells fruit juices. Zulekha is a very enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. She always struggles to improve her fruit parlor, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Zulekha is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw fruits for the preparation of juices.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw fruits

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a single woman with two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Sophia has operated a bookshop business for the past eight years. She sells to her neighbors and house constructors who come to buy from her. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase textbooks and exercise books for sale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a wholesale bookshop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase textbooks and exercise books for sale.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 51 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Wilma is borrowing 29,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.

Wilma has been raising pigs for 28 years and also earns additional income from selling seafood.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah operates a tree nursery and flower business, selling to agricultural farms and forest industries. She also sells coconuts, which provide her other source of livelihood. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other flower operators as her major challenge. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, Serah wants to pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Qamile

texts.en: Qamile is a previous Kiva client who used lenders' financial help to purchase a washing machine. She is now applying for another little loan of 50,000 Albanian lek (ALL) to add a refrigerator. "Maybe this is a little thing to some people, but this is a big one for me; it's a luxury," Qamile said. "I am very happy now to have the washing machine. It made my life easier, because before I had to wash everything by hand. I can't wait to get a refrigerator to store my grandchildren's food. I want to thank everyone who supported me financially, all those kind and generous lenders that felt for me."

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 48-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her family. She is a mother of 8 children and a responsible and hardworking housewife. Her husband has a construction material supplies business. Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. With the help of the loan, her husband will purchase bricks, cement, and other construction materials and then sell them for a profit in the main market. By doing so, he is confident that he will easily increase his net income and savings for the future. Parveen is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Sobira

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Sobira works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in Tajikistan, and she has had this business for a year and earns income to provide her family with all the necessary things. 

 Sobira works hardly from early morning till late night. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money. In the future, Sobira hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children.

Sobira is asking for a loan of 4000 somoni to buy children's clothes for the new season. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve her business and her biggest dream will come true: “To be a rich business lady”.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has operated a business of selling palm leaves for thatching houses for the past one year. In addition she also sells firewood which earns her another source of livelihood. She sells to her neighbors and house constructors who come to buy from her. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase palm leaves and add to her savings and purchase a motorcycle for a transport business.  She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establishing a wholesale shop for selling palm leaves in the near future. Once more she appreciates the help.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves and add to her savings to purchase a motorcycle for a transport business.

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “God Is Great” group from Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Emma is the featured leader of this group. The 30-year-old is married to a trader and they have one child who is attending primary school. Emma has been a businesswoman for five years now, she sells plastic bowls. With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of plastic bowls to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of plastic bowls to add to her current stock

loans.name: Fakhreyye

texts.en:
Fakhreyye is from Iraq. She is 59 years old, married, and has fou children. Fakhreyye, her husband and two of her children, together provide the family income.

Fakhreyye tailors women's outfits. She has much experience in this field since she has done tailoring ever since she was a  teenager. In 2005, Fakhreyye established her small business in her house and started providing tailoring services in her neighborhood. The good quality of her work gave Fakhreyya an excellent reputation in the surroundings.

Fakhreyya is requesting a loan of $1,800 which she will use to renovate her workplace. She aims to continue to grow in her business and increase her profit so that she will be able to provide her family with better living standards.

loans.use: to renovate her workplace

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after other family members.

She has been selling green bananas in the market on a retail basis for one year, working six days a week. She also sells Irish potatoes as another source of income.

She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more green bananas and sacks of Irish potatoes for sale. Her challenges include unstable supplies and seasonality. Her dream is to be able to buy a lorry full of green bananas, become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. 

She joined MCDT because she wanted to be one of the breadwinners in the family. She stays with her husband in a rented house without access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more green bananas and Irish potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a food vending business for the past eight years, cooking chapati (flat bread), rice and beans. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food vending business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food vending business.

loans.name: Development Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the Development Group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 500,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Mustapha is the featured leader of this group. Mustapha is 45 years old; he is married with five children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Mustapha sells sticks. With the help of this loan, he will invest in his business by buying a large quantity of sticks to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of sticks to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Jameela Group

texts.en:
Jameela is a 35-year-old woman who is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and five children. Her husband is a diabetic and she always worries about his health. For 20 years her husband has been running a wood shop, which is the only source of income for their family. He is an excellent carpenter and he has good skills at making quality furniture. 

As a member of this 4-person group, Jameela has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband in his business. Her husband would purchase a wood cutting machine and some tools like a hammer, nails, wooden sheets, etc., for his shop. As they have no other source of income, with the help of this loan, her husband will be able to continue his business, and with the net profit he will open a new shop for his son. 

Jameela dreams of her children's bright future and prays for her husband's good health. NOTE: In the picture Jameela is raising her hand

loans.use: To purchase a wood cutting machine

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su esposo y su hijo de 4 años. Ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; ella es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante quiere correr el riesgo para poder hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. La clienta  tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en:
The client lives with her husband and their 4-year-old child. She has a tortilla business which is well-known in the area she lives. She has many customers as she sells the best tortillas; hot, with the quickest service and at reasonable prices. She is an enterprising woman who really wants to come out ahead. 

She’s willing to take a risk to be able to make her business grow and that is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to purchase corn at wholesale. The client hopes this way she will be able to bring economic security to her home and a full life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.es: Evangelista, tiene 39 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de la Masica, Atlántida. Ella lleva cuatro años de tener su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos, vende champú, tratamientos para el cabello, lociones, desodorantes, cremas, etc. el negocio se ha mantenido estable mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente esta solicitando un sexto préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para surtir el negocio de productos de cosméticos como champú, lociones, cremas, desodorantes y otros que le soliciten sus clientes. El propósito es mantener variedad de productos, aumentar las ventas y las ganancias. Su plan es que el negocio prospere para que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
39-year old Evangelista is married and has four children. She lives in a small village in the municipality of La Masica, Atlántida. She has had her own business for four years selling cosmetics, shampoo, hair treatments, lotions, deodorants, creams etc. By investing money from several loans, Evangelista has created a stable business.

She is now seeking a sixth loan of 15,000 lempiras to buy stock such as cosmetics, shampoo, lotions, creams, and deodorants--items sought by her customers. Her goals are to stock a variety of products, and increase sales and earnings. Evangelista’s plan is for the business to prosper so that her children lack for nothing.

loans.use: buy stock such as cosmetics, shampoo, lotions, creams, and deodorants

loans.name: Angham

texts.en:
Angham is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been working in her convenience store since four years ago. She is a hard worker who puts so much effort into supporting her husband, who works painting houses, in covering their family's expenses and providing their children the good standards of living.

Angham is a multitasking person; in addition to her store, she also sells used clothes and shoes to increase her income and develop her family's social and financial living.

Today, Angham is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a car that will help her a lot in her business, especially for visiting wholesale trade markets and buying requested items for her shop. She will also use it for the clothes and shoes business to expand customers and the market for her business, which will expand her working zone and might encourage her to open another branch. Through the requested car, Angham might target rural areas with her products, which will surely increase her income.

She hopes to be capable of developing the used clothes business more, and she is working hard to start a wholesale trade in the future.

loans.use: To buy a car that is necessary for improving her business.

loans.name: Azizpocho

texts.en:
Azizpocho is from Tajikistan. It’s a country where one can disconnect from the noise and appreciate the beauty of nature, since its scenery is very beautiful. Azizpocho loves her country very much.

She is 51 years old. Azizpocho is a widow and has two children. To make a living, she has her own café, where she sells food. She cooks very tasty national food and has her own clients. She has been engaged in her business for 13 years and earns money for living expenses. She works around 10 hours a day. She thinks her activity is going well because she is very kind and she always loves what she does.

She is requesting a loan of 2,000 somoni, which will be used to buy a fridge and table and chairs for her cafe. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and table and chairs for her cafe.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 33-year-old lady. She is married to Joseph and is a mother of five children. She has rental houses and a pig farm in Kiambu. Susan has been in the business for five years now and gets a monthly income of 35,000 shillings. 

This will be Susan's second loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy animal feeds, medicine and also farm inputs to improve her farming. 

She plans to use the profits to purchase piglet meals, drugs for de-worming and implements for the farming business. In the future, she wants to do horticultural farming.

loans.use: To purchase pig feeds and medicine for the pigs.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a single lady of fifty years; she has three children and one grand-daughter whom she takes care of. She sells used clothing in Kangemi and has been in this business for twenty-two years. She gets a monthly income of forty-five thousand shillings.

This will be Eunice's first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy more clothes for selling. In future she wants to be a prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy milk and a refrigerator for milk sales business

loans.name: Jesylida

texts.en:
Jesylida has been blessed with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a fruit and vegetables sales stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruit, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a general store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Hermenegildo German

texts.es: Don Hermenegildo, un señor soltero solo en la vida que con sacrificio dio lo necesario a sus hijos, quienes ahora son mayores de edad e independientes, es una persona que a lo largo del camino se ha defendido económicamente vendiendo reposterías entre otras cosas para poder sustentar sus gastos. Hoy en día se dedica también a vender controles para televisores, cartucheras y accesorios para celulares entre otros y este crédito que solicita es para comprar los productos mencionados para continuar con las ventas las cuales las hace de manera ambulante con una mochila bajo el sol y lluvia para lograr obtener el ingreso del día, así como don Hermenegildo hay muchas personas en Nicaragua que han adoptado esta medio de ingresos, por la falta de empleo.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo is a single gentleman who is alone in this life.  With sacrifice, he gave his children the necessities.  They are now adults and independent.  He is a person, who along the way, has supported himself financially by selling pastries, among other things, in order to be able to pay his expenses.

He now also sells remote controls for televisions, pencil cases, and cell phone accessories, among others.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy the mentioned products in order to continue with the sales.  He makes his sales in an itinerant manner with a backpack.  He works under the sun and the rain in order to manage to get the daily income.  There are a lot of people in Nicaragua who, like Hermenegildo, have adopted this way of getting income due to the lack of employment.

loans.use: to buy remote controls for televisions, pencil cases, and cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora W Group

texts.es:
La señora Juana de estado civil unida de hecho, cuenta con 45 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ella tiene 6 hijos y de ellos 4 van a la escuela, ella se dedica al comercio especificamente a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras, inició este negocio por la necesidad de generar su propio empleo; también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante.

Organiza un grupo y decise solicitar un préstamo que lo va a utilizar para ampliar su negocio comprando más verduras y frutas, en el futuro desea que su negocio prosere y que tenga mejores ventas; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y a la agricultura, sembrndo tomate, sebolla y ajo y lo venden. Cabe mencionar que en la foto aparecen 10 personas pero solo a 8 se le concedio el préstamo.
texts.en:
45-year old Sra. Juana lives with her common-law partner. She didn’t go to school. She has six children, four of whom attend school. Juana earns her living selling fruit and vegetables, a business she began when she needed to find a job. She has the support of her husband who is a businessman.

She has organized a group to seek a loan. She plans to use her share of the money to expand her business and buy more fruit and vegetables. Her wish is for her business to prosper so she can sell more. The other members of the group have businesses or work in agriculture growing tomatoes, onions, and garlic which they then sell. 

It should be noted that ten people appear in the photo but only eight receive the loan.

loans.use: buy fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a woman of 57 years. She is married to Stephen and a mother of four children. She supplies tomatoes in Kawangware. Florence has been in the business for 30 years, and she gets a monthly income of 100,000 shillings.

This will be Florence's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase 10 crates of tomatoes. She plans to use the profits to pay back the loan and plow back into the business. 

In the future, she wants to be a successful businesswoman and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase 10 crates of tomatoes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary earns her income by selling clothes. She plans to use this loan to buy a water tank to harvest water during the rainy season. The project will take two weeks to complete and benefit seven family members and many neighbors. 

This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM, and the previous loans she has repaid successfully. The community here faces the challenge of water shortages, when they travel long distances to fetch water. Mary hopes to be a role model to fellow villagers by helping people lead a better life. She is a hopeful woman and patient.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Stephen L.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you these primary school teachers from Kenema city, in eastern Sierra Leone. Founded in 1987, this school is staffed with three teachers and has an enrollment of 122 pupils. 

This is the first loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Moiwai is the featured leader of this group of teachers. The 52-year-old Moiwai was born in Kamboma in the eastern part of Sierra Leone. He has been in the teaching profession for 27 years now. He is married to a housewife, and the couple has five children: two are attending secondary school, two are in college and one is not of school-going age. Moiwai has requested this loan in order to purchase house building materials like cement, etc., for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to purchase house building materials like cement, etc., for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en: Nader, 32, is the father of two kids. Nader has a small carpentry workshop, which permits him to support his family. Nader is working on expanding his workshop area to include more equipment, so he is applying for a loan to buy a new cutting machine.

loans.use: to buy a new cutting machine for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 36-years-old father of two girls and one son. He has a fruits and vegetable shop in a good location in the market. He applied for this loan as he is working on expanding the shop. He needs to redecorate the shop in a way to include as many goods as possible and which makes it easy for the customer to reach out for what he wants. And Ahmad wants to bring more fruits and vegetables from the main market.

loans.use: to bring more fruits and vegetables from the main market and redecorate the shop.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

In the past she has operated a firewood selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is high cost of transportation.

With the loan, she is requesting Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase more bunches of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bunches of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Houd

texts.en: Houd is 22 years old  and a single man who works and studies at the same time.  Houd is one of six siblings living together. He goes to college to get a diploma degree in managerial information systems and hopes that he can continue to get a bachelor's degree, too. He is applying for an educational loan to pay his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his next semester fees.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es: carlos es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su compañera de vida, sus dos hijos y su madre, es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra maíz y sorgo.  carlos  desea incrementar sus ventas y por solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía que es donde desea sembrar sus cultivos. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Carlos is a very responsible man with obligations to his home, as he has always been characterized as proving the best for his family. Now he lives with his life partner, their two children and his mother. He is a very hard-worker and does his work with happiness and enthusiasm. He is a farmer who grows corn and sorghum. 

Carlos wants to increase his sales and to request a loan which will allow him to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides among other items and improve his land, which is shown in this photo, where he wants to grow his crops. He hopes to have the assistance requested since he has no other income and thus will continue to bring home money each day to his family without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizers, pesticides etc...

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: Don Juan de 49 años de edad  es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia.  Actualmente vive junto a su esposa es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos los años  maíz y sorgo. Juan desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna
texts.en: Juan is 49 years old.  He is a responsible man with home obligations and has always been known for providing the best to his family.  Currently, he lives with his wife.  She works very hard and has always done so with joy and enthusiasm.  She is engaged in farming, planting corn and sorghum every year.  Juan wishes to increase his sales and for this reason, he visited Integral’s office.  He is requesting a loan that will permit him to purchase seeds, organic fertilizer, fertilizer, pesticides, and other inputs.  He wishes to have the requested assistance since he has no other cash income.  With this loan, he will continue taking home the daily bread without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, organic fertilizer, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis, es viudo y tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son independientes, vive en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación pequeña, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe una renta de jubilación mensual, del cual debe solventar su alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia, ya que ayuda a sus nietos pagando sus estudios.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materiales de construcción como arena y ladrillos para la refacción de su vivienda ya que desea brindarles mas seguridad y comodidad a su familia.
El sueño de Luis, es construir más habitaciones para poder acoger a sus hijos y nietos, y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Luis is a widower and has three grown children. He lives in one small room in his own house located in the Alto Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz. He  receives a monthly pension with which he has to buy food and pay for basic services for his family. He also helps pay for his grandchildren’s education.
The loan he is seeking is to buy construction materials such as sand and bricks to renovate his house as he wishes to provide his family with more security and comfort.

Luis’s dream is to build more houses so that his children and grandchildren have somewhere to live and improve their standard of living. 

This is his third loan with IMPRO and his second with Kiva.

loans.use: buy sand and bricks to renovate part of his house

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is single, and she owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Riziki has operated a boutique shop business for the past two years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She mentioned the high and low seasons as being the challenge in her business. She dreams of establishing a big boutique in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase clothes for men, women and children for resale for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for men, women and children for resale for her business.

loans.name: Khairya

texts.en: Khairya, 48 years old is the mother of eight children. After her husband retired, he started working as a security guard in a telecom company. Her eldest sons are either in military school or working in farming businesses. All are helping to improve their living conditions. Khairya buys and sells blankets from home. Now Khairya is applying for a loan to add new summer-weight bed sheets and covers to sell.

loans.use: to add new summer-weight bed sheets and covers to sell in her home-based business.

loans.name: Philip A.k.'s Group

texts.en: Pictured here are teachers from a primary school located in Kenama, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a Kiva partner based in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone, to apply for a loan of 5,500,000 SLL (Sierra Leonean Leones). With the help of this loan, they can meet their immediate and most pressing financial needs and, at the end of each month, their school’s bursar can easily repay the loan on their behalf out of their salaries. Philip is their featured leader. He is 52 years old. Born in Feiba, he is married to a trader, and the couple have two children who are attending secondary school. Philip has been a schoolteacher for 32 years. He has applied for this loan in order to buy building materials, including corrugated iron sheets, sand, cement and iron rods, to build a house.

loans.use: to buy building materials, including corrugated iron sheets, sand, cement and iron rods, to build a house.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en: Shameem is an enterprising woman with many dreams to realize. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her six children. She loves her family and claims they are her greatest source of strength to get up every morning and work hard to generate an income. Since 2003, she has been working as a tailor. She provides stitching services in her community. Her eldest daughter also helps her in sewing dresses. She has excellent skills and, due to the money she generates, she has managed to provide a better quality of life for her family. Her greatest wish is to expand her business and to buy another sewing machine, as the number of her customers increases day by day. However, because she has only one machine, she cannot easily meet  with all the customer demand on time, and that results in a loss of money and customers. Therefore, she is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to invest in the purchase of a sewing machine, which will allow her to cover the demands of customers more efficiently and to elevate her level of income. With the profits, she will pay the educational expenses of her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is 21 years old and single. She has 8 siblings living all together in the same house as their parents. To help in supporting herself and participate in paying some of the household bills, Amani started working in a tailoring from home where most of the neighborhood comes to her to do some sewing work. 

She is now applying for a youth loan to get a new sewing machine and new sewing tools to improve the quality of her productivity. She also wants to search for a small place where she can expand her business and turn it into an independent one close to her house.

loans.use: to get a new sewing machine and new sewing tools to improve the quality of her work.

loans.name: Binoikhon

texts.en: Binoikhon is 59 years old and married. She sells children's clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for 7 years. She sells her goods at the local market and has her own customers. She dreams of expanding her business and becoming prosperous in the future. She needs a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy children's clothes for the new season. She will look forward to your help. This loan will help her to have a wide assortment of goods and in this way it will help her to develop the business. She promises to make her payment on time.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Ruba

texts.en:
Ruba is a 38-year-old conservative woman. She asked her husband, who helps her in the business, to appear in the photo in her place. They have four children to support.

Ruba’s husband owns a distribution bus. Using the bus, Ruba and her husband are able to distribute grains and legumes to different shops. They get them in large quantity for a good price and re-pack them in smaller quantities based on the shop's demands. Now Ruba is applying for another loan so she can include selling spice grains. In the future, she hopes to get another distribution bus to expand her coverage area.

loans.use: to acquire spice grains to resell

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, both of whom attend school. She is not looking after additional family members.

She has been selling newspapers in a rented shop for twenty years, working six days a week. She sells airtime and mobile telephones for additional income.

She has requested a loan of 450,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more newspapers for resale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to expand the business to a bigger shop, to start selling mobile phone accessories and to build rental rooms. She joined MCDT because of the timely loans. She lives in her house, which has access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more newspapers for resale

loans.name: Ife Lodoun 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFE LODOUN 1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies du quartier et qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, nommée Valérie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Valérie est âgée de 37 ans. Valérie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Valérie ne vit plus avec son mari. Valérie est mère de quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés. Valérie vit avec ses enfants et assure seule les diverses charges des enfants. Pour ce faire, Valérie vend divers articles et des produits cosmétiques par la méthode de distribution. Valérie s’approvisionne au Nigéria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Valérie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe IFE LODOUN 1, un  premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The IFE Lodoun 1 group is made up of three people who are friends from the same neighbourhood and belong to the same tontine group. The representative of the group who is named Valerie is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Valerie is 37 years old. She did not attend school. Valerie no longer lives with her husband. She has four children, some of which go to school. Valerie lives with her children and assumes the various expenses for them alone. To do this, Valerie sells various articles and cosmetic products as a distributor. Valerie buys her stock in Nigeria. In order to satisfy her customers and to increase her turnover and her income, with the other members of the IFE Loudoun 1 group, Valerie requests a first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Fayziniso

texts.en: The traditional Tajik women’s dresses which are made by Fayziniso are very wonderful.  She is 59 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a kind man who tries to help her with all her transactions. They want to provide comfort for their children and grandchildren, with all the modern conveniences. The fast development of the modern world makes her grandchildren more progressive.   She tries to provide them with a better quality of life, and that is why, 13 years ago, she began her own business sewing traditional women’s dresses . She has own workshop in the center of her town. Thanks to the good service she provides, she has managed to gain many customers. Since she has had her business, her family’s quality of life has been improving. She wants to develop her business further, but she needs to buy a new sewing machine. She is applying for a loan of 2,500 TJS (Tajikstani Somoni) to buy a sewing machine. She promises to make her payments on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and develop her business.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children and all of them attend school. She is also looking after her old parents.

She has been running a retail shop in rented premises for five years, working six days a week. She does not have any additional source of income.

Jacqueline has requested a loan of UShs 700,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cartons of salt, cooking oil and sacks of cereals for sale. Her challenges include thieves. Her dream is to open a supermarket. 

Jacqueline joined MCDT because she considered it reliable. She lives in her house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cooking oil, cartons of salt  and sacks of cereals.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She is also looking after her mother.

Harriet has been selling green bananas in the market at retail for the last 10 years, working six days a week. She does not have another source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 600,000 from MCDT SACCO to enable her buy more bunches of green bananas for sale. Her challenges include seasonality, thieves and transportation. Her dream is to be able to stock at least 20 bunches of bananas per week. She joined MCDT because it was easy for her to do so. 

Harriet stays with her husband in a rented house with access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married Iraqi client, who is 31 years old and is a father of one child. Ali is the only provider for his family.

Ali owns a grocery shop where he sells shampoos, perfumes, detergents, dairy products, snacks and juices. He has been running this business since 2009 and has gained good experience in this field. Now Ali has hired an employee and is well-known in the neighborhood.

Ali is requesting a loan of $2,400. He will use this loan to install a rolling shutter and to buy two new refrigerators. Ali is aiming to continue to grow his business so that he may provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter and to buy two new refrigerators

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and all of them attend school. She is not looking after any other family members.

She has been selling second-hand clothes from the market and door-to-door on a retail basis for seven years, working seven days a week. She earns additional income from the motorcycle that she hires out.

She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy bales of more skirts and blouses for sale. Her challenges include seasonality, transportation and thieves. Her dream is to acquire a fully stocked boutique. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charged on loans. 

She stays in her husband's house without access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of skirts and blouses for resale.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie was widowed some time back. Two out of her four children are still attending school; one of them goes to university, and the other one is finishing high school this academic year.  

She was brought up in a beautiful picturesque village until she reached 18. This village that is located in northern Albania has been frequented during these past twenty-something years of liberation from the communist leadership by thousands of foreign visitors every year. However, for all these years, Marie has been living in a town where she’s been operating her dental laboratory. 

Marie is now requesting a loan through Kiva lenders to purchase some lab equipment. This will be her first loan altogether, and she hopes that lenders will consider lending to her.

loans.use: To purchase some equipment for her dental laboratory.

loans.name: Jannet

texts.es:
Jannet  trabaja en una de las dependencias del Estado. Es soltera y tiene un hijo que está en edad escolar.
Jannet vive en casa propia en la zona 8 de mayo de la ciudad de La Paz.
Ella necesita un crédito para la compra de una computadora portátil que le servirá mucho en su trabajo, pues necesita muchas veces elaborar informes y el tiempo no le alcanza en su trabajo.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO y de Kiva
texts.en: Jannet works in one of the state offices.  She is single and has a school aged son.  Jannet lives in her own home in the “Mayo de 8” [May 8th] region of La Paz.  She needs a loan to purchase a laptop computer, which will help her very much in her job because she often needs to create reports and she doesn’t have enough time at work.  This is the first time she is requesting a loan from Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop computer.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a farmer from Ndunyu Njeru and also keeps livestock for sale. He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy livestock for sale. He has paid his previous loan on time. With anticipated profit, he hopes to pay school fees and expand his business.

He hopes to be selling livestock wholesale in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase livestock, i.e. goats, sheep and a cow.

loans.name: Armik

texts.en:
Armik is a teacher with many years of experience teaching in the local school. She lives in a small village called Mrgavan in the Ararat region. Unfortunately, a teacher’s salary is not enough to make ends meet for a family of six: herself, her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two little grandchildren. 

Her farming business helps her family to have stable income during the month. Armik cultivates tomatoes and grows peach, apricot, apple and pear trees as well. Armik's son sells the gathered harvest locally and collects the money, which is vital for sustaining the family.

With the requested loan from SEF International, Armik would like to expand her farming business. With the loan's help, she will purchase tomato seeds and fertilizer and cover cultivation costs. The loan is very important for Armik and her family to enlarge their farm and be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for tomato seeds and fertilizer and cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Bardhe

texts.en:
Bardhe is 41 years old and lives in the northwestern part of the country. Livestock and agriculture have been her only activities since her early twenties. She says, “I find it very rewarding in a sense: I practice my love for animals and the planting/harvesting skills at the same time. I also like to sell and talk to people. And I get joy when I sell my products, whether dairies or veggies and grains. Clients keep coming back to me seeking for me and my products, and this is what I enjoy the most. And of course the income I generate from what I do.”

Bardhe has three children and is married. This is not the first loan through VFA’s institution, but it is her first one via KIVA and she is excited. Her previous loans were paid off on time. The loan she is requesting now will be used to expand the existing animal stable.

loans.use: To expand her existing animal stable

loans.name: Hands Together Group

texts.en: Fatmata is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fatmata was born 39 years ago in Makeni city. She is married to a businessman and the couple has 4 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. For 10 years now, Fatmata has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (use to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, and other items. This is the first loan that Fatmata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Fatmata will use her share of the loan 500,000 SLL to buy palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, and other items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, pepper, and other items at wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 28-year-old single woman who has been working in fashion design and tailoring since five years ago. In 2010, she started her own business. Sanaa is a hard worker with a very good reputation in her region. She is recommended by her customers. 

Sanaa is working hard to develop her business. She is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy newly released textiles and tailoring materials necessary for her business development and needs.

Sanaa is looking forward to expanding her business in a way that she can attract more customers, develop her business, and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy newly released textiles and tailoring materials necessary for her business.

loans.name: Nubar

texts.en:
A teacher in the past, Nubar has been trading since 2009 in different kinds of food products from her shop in Artashat town. Nubar works hard to have good sales and gather income, which is very important for sustaining her family of five: Nubar herself, her son, daughter-in-law and two little grandchildren.

Due to her hard work and kind attitude toward people, Nubar has gained many loyal customers. 

Now, in order to create comfortable conditions and meet her clients' needs, Nubar has applied for this loan to SEF International. With the requested loan, Nubar will renovate her shop and will be able to purchase more vegetables and sell them to customers.

The loan is very important for Nubar to improve her shop and gather more income, which is very important for sustaining her family's life.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the shop, and vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Angel Ruben

texts.es: Don angel de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, el trabaja en una constructora de albañil desde hace 17 años con el pago de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el desea construir un cuarto para sus hijos y poner el techo en el corredor de su vivienda pero con lo que le pagan no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por eso solicita un crédito para comprar todo los materiales como: cemento, laminas, hierro, arena, etc. y asi poder construir su vivienda como el siempre lo ha soñado para que pueda  vivir más tranquilo y seguro con su familia.
texts.en:
Angel is 60 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and 4 children. He works in a construction company where he has been employed for 17 years. With the income from his job he manages to pay for some household expenses. 

He wants to build a bedroom for his children and to put a roof on the hallway but his income isn’t enough to make this happen, that is why he is requesting a loan, to purchase all the materials such as cement, sheet metal, iron, sand etc… Thus he will be able to build his house as he has always dreamed so that he can live more peacefully and safely with his family.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, sheet metal etc...

loans.name: Kondokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KONDOKPO est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Madeleine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Madeleine est âgée de 33 ans. Madeleine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Madeleine est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Christophe. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Madeleine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour ce faire Madeleine vend des divers(des conserves, sucre et des pâtes alimentaires)dans son quartier depuis quatre ans. Madeleine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Madeleine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KONDOKPO, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Kondokpo group is made up of four people who reside in the same neighbourhood. The representative of the group, named Madeleine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Madeleine is 33 years old. She did not go to school. Madeleine is married to a fisherman called Christophe. They have three children, which all attend school at their expense. Madeleine lives with her husband and her children. The couple shares the family expenses. To do this Madeleine has been selling various products (conserves, sugar, and pasta) in her neighbourhood for four years. Madeleine buys her stock at a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her clientele and increase her turnover and her income, with the other members of the Kondokpo group, Madeleine requests a fourth loan from Alidé. The previous loans were repaid correctly.

loans.use: To buy conserves and pasta.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 21-year-old single man. He is the oldest brother of four. Khaled is a university student majoring in accounting. He also works in a fast food restaurant to cover his allowance. Khaled is applying today for an educational loan to pay his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his next semester fees.

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika is married to a businessman and together they have children, all of whom attend school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She cites theft and high cost of transportation as her major challenges in the business. 

She is requesting Kshs 40,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale in order to meet the needs of her clients. She dreams of expanding to a boutique shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling groceries and charcoal in Bogyano (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for seven years. 

Adjoa is married and has four children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Adjoa wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries and charcoal. In the long term, Adjoa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling groceries in Bogyano (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 2 years. Adjoa is married and has 3 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of groceries for resale, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of groceries for resale.

loans.name: Taj

texts.en: Taj is 57-year-old vigorous lady; she has been doing embroidery work for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 35000 PKR to Kashf Foundation. She intends to buy more spools of threads in different colors, as well as packs of pearls and sequins to create a means of increasing revenues so that she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, as well as packs of pearls and sequins.

loans.name: Alodo Alome Group

texts.fr: ALODO ALOME est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Eugénie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Eugénie est âgée 42 ans. Eugénie est mariée à un certain Rémy. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Eugénie a très peu fréquenté l'école. Eugénie et son mari assurent ensemble les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Eugénie vend des produits vivriers depuis quinze ans. Eugénie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Eugénie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALODO ALOME, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Alodo Alome is a group of three people, all the members live in the same neighbourhood. The leader of the group, named Eugenie is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Eugenie is 42 years old. She is married to a man called Remy. They have three children, which all go to school at their expense. Eugenie went to school very little. She and her husband share the family expenses. In order to manage this Eugenie has been selling food products for 15 years. Eugenie buys her stock at a market in Benin. In order to reinforce her business and satisfy her customers' demand, Eugenie and the other members of the Alodo Alome group, request a fourth loan from Alidé. The previous loans were repaid correctly.

loans.use: To buy food products.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is very happy to have a reliable and experienced partner like Kiva, with whose help he can easily overcome any difficulties. Artak is married and he lives with his wife, three school-aged children and his parents. His family helps him very much and it is obvious that group work always gives good results. He and his family are busy both in farming and in agriculture. They successfully sell potatoes planted in their garden, since they have sowed the best grades of it. Artak also breeds cows, sheep and a pig in his farm. The income from the sale of milk and meat is a great help for his family as well.

Artak asks for a loan from Kiva not for the first time and he surely knows how to use it according to the purpose. With the loan, Artak plans to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for his farm and he really hopes to receive good profits.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for his agricultural business

loans.name: Sayyeda

texts.en:
Sayyeda is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for 10 years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members alone.

Sayyeda is a motivated mother of two. She is liable to provide them with good quality food, education and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of 25,000 PKR. The amount will be used to purchase a large quantity of rubber bladders, leather covers and spools of thread to cater to more customers without delay. She is hopeful to get an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and hopes to use part of the profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of rubber bladders, leather covers and spools of thread.

loans.name: Cantzelaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Angelina de estado civil casada, tien 39 años de edad, curso 2 años de educacion primaria, tiene 4 hijos y 3 de ellos estan estudiando, ella se dedica a vender carnes, especificamente pollo y chorizo, inició este negocio vendiendo solamente chorizos y hasta la fecha lleva ya 10 años de dichosa experiencia. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en una gasolinera.

Organiza un grupo y decide solicitar un prestamos que lo va utilizar para ampliar su capital y asi poder comprar mas pollo y chorizos ya que tiene mas demanda, en el futuro quiere tener un local grande para poder distribuir por mayor. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio venta de verduras y carnes. Es importante hacer ver que en la fotografía aperecen 8 señoras pero solo a 7 de ellas se le concedio el préstamo.
texts.en:
Angelina is a 39 year old married woman.  She completed two years of primary school education and has four children, three of whom are in school.  She is engaged in selling meat, specifically chicken and sausage.  She started this business selling only sausages and to date, she has already had ten years of blessed experience. She has the help of her husband who works in a gas station.

She organized a group and decided to request a loan that would be used to raise capital and in this way, purchase more chicken and sausage as she has more demand.  In the future, she wants to have a large local to be able to distribute wholesale.  The rest of the group are engaged in trade, selling vegetables and meats.  It is important to note that eight woman appear in the photograph but only seven of them were granted the loan.

loans.use: to buy and sell chicken and sausage.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Villa Pabon de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas al día como estilista canino, y con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para el capital de trabajo para comprar instrumentos como tijeras especiales, shampoo, acondicionador, etc., ya que desea ofrecer sus servicios como estilista canino los fines de semana de forma independiente ya que con esto lograra mejorar sus ingresos y a futuro poder independizarse.
El sueño de Jose luis es tener su negocio propio para obtener más ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera con KIVA.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is single and has no children. He lives at his parents’ house that consists of only one room. The house is located in the District of Villa Pabon in the city of La Paz.

Jose Luis currently works more than eight hours a day as a dog groomer. With his earnings, he is able to cover expenses such as food and basic services. The loan he is requesting will be used as working capital for buying instruments such as special scissors, as well as shampoo, conditioner, and other supplies. He wants to offer his services as an independent dog groomer on the weekends so that he can earn more income and start his own business in the future.

His dream is to have a business of his own so that he can generate more income and improve his quality of life. This is the first time that Jose Luis has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy scissors, shampoo, conditioner, and other supplies for providing dog grooming services.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Ms. Shabana is a 38-year-old, vigorous, married woman and the mother of four children. She has been doing a business of hand-embroidery for the past four years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong, but business challenges combined with family expenditures frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is a laborer in a factory with a low income. 

Two years ago, when Ms. Shabana borrowed from Kashf for the first time, she purchased raw materials. Now she requested another loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase more spools of thread and packs of pearls, sequins and glittering material in various colors. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread with packs of pearls, sequins and glittering material in various colors.

loans.name: Ulises De Jesus

texts.es: Don ulises se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz cuando la cosecha a pasado se dedica a trabajar de ayudante de albañilería,  con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas y el pago de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su familia en casa propia. El está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc.  ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener un mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Don Ulises has been farming for several years. He grows beans and corn. Once the harvest has passed, he spends his time working as a masonry assistant. From the sale of his harvested crops and with the income from his job, he is able to pay for the household expenses. Ulises is a responsible, honest, and hardworking man who lives in his own home with his family.

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy supplies for his crops such as fertilizers, compost, seeds, and other items since he does not earn enough to cover these expenses. As a result, he will be able to generate more income and have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, seeds, and other supplies.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small store in her house for the last two years. She offers various items: biscuits, candies, chips, etc. Her husband is a salesperson in a garment shop and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is a mother of two and is motivated to provide for her family.

In order to inflate her sales, Jameela requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of biscuits, cookies, toffees and crackers. With these items, she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She wishes to spend part of the revenues on dealing with the expenses of her children’s education and expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy packs of biscuits, cookies, toffees and crackers.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Ms. Sultana is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for the past many years and earns enough to lead a decent life. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) to buy stock of threads in different colors with packs of zippers and buttons to meet with the increasing demand of her customers. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela vive en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz.  Es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta al por menor de artículos de bellza y joyería.
