El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de artículos de belleza, como cremas de día y de noche, perfumes, lápices labiales, etc., para continuar con su negocio de venta de los mismos.
Esta es la segunda vez que su préstamo se canaliza a través de Kiva.  Graciela se encuentra muy contenta de poder acceder a este tipo de préstamos.
texts.en:
Graciela lives in the District of Miraflores in the city of La Paz. She is single and has no children. She works selling beauty products and jewellery on a retail basis.

The loan she is requesting is to buy more beauty products, such as day and night creams, perfumes, lipsticks, etc., in order to keep her retail sales business going.

This is the second loan that she has requested through Kiva. Graciela is very happy to be able to access this type of loan.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for resale to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, cuando sus cultivos ya estan listos los almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarlos a las agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con su esposa, su hijo, sus padres y una hermana. El cliente  esta solicitando un crédito para poder comparar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
The borrower has worked as a farmer for many years, which has given him the ability and knowledge necessary to care for his crops.  His main crops are corn and beans.  When they are ready, he stores them in the silos shown in the photograph to later sell at the basic grains agencies close to his home.  The income he earns from his sales help with his family expenses.  He lives with his wife, his son, his parents, and his sister.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural supplies that will help with the planting of his crops such as manure, seeds, and fertilizer.  This will allow him to improve his profits and continue helping with the household expenses without limitations.

loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizer, and other items.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Ms Sadia is a 26-year-old married lady living with her husband and little baby. She is very talented and excels at the art of stitching. Her services are greatly appreciated by her community and she makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband is working as a laborer but his income is not enough to cover the household expenses. Thus, Sadia wants to support her family by using her stitching skills. To meet her customers’ orders on time, she has requested a loan of 15,000 rupees to buy a stock of different colored threads and packs of buttons and zippers. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of having a good standard of living through all the hard work she puts into her business.

loans.use: to buy thread, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 44-year-old married woman and mother of eight. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. To fulfill the demands of her children, she started her business of manufacturing window chicks (curtains) with bamboo. She makes chicks at home and then sells them to the people of her community and in the local market. From this business she earns profits to meet the expenses of the household.

In order to purchase bundles of bamboo and some utensils, such as cutters and scissors, she applied to Kashf Foundation for a loan of 20,000 PKR. The loan capital will help her to increase her production of curtains and increase her sales. She wishes to spend a part of her profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of bamboo and some utensils, such as cutters and scissors.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last ten years. She has become famous in her community for providing good quality products and makes enough to lead a decent life. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone.

Abida is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to expand her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her second loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 46-year-old married woman who has been in the business of milk sales for the past 10 years. She has two milk cows and sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and that she makes from the milk. Her husband is a private employee, but her husband's income is not sufficient to meet all their expenses with ease. That is why she is working hard to contribute to the family income. She has three children, and two of them are school-going. 

Irshad is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase one more cow. In this way she would be able to inflate her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of her income on providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Selvin Rolando

texts.es: Selvin  se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, comercializa sus cultivos en los ventas de granos básicos y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios accesibles, adicional a su trabajo en el campo también trabaja de jornal en una finca que está cerca de su casa, Selvin es un hombre  dedicado  a su labor,  quiere aprovechar el auge de su negocio para aumentar la producción y así poder tener mejores ganancias, necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso  solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc.  para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Selvin works as a farmer, specifically planting corn and beans.  He has worked in this area for many years and it has given him valuable experience that allows him to have the best harvests.  The land he plants is located in an agricultural zone.  He sells his crops at the basic grain sales and has loyal customers who always prefer his products since they are high quality and sold at affordable prices.  In addition to working as a farmer, he also works as a day laborer at a farm near his home.  

Selvin is a man dedicated to his work.  He wants to take advantage of the success of his business to increase production so that he can have more income by investing in supplies.  In order to do this, he is requesting a loan that will allow him to purchase seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, and tools so that he can earn more income and give his family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, and tools.

loans.name: Arfana

texts.en:
Arfana is a 33-year-old married lady. She has been in the stitching business for six years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household with the educational needs of the children. That is why she started sewing clothes at home to support her family. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business.

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in different colors. In this way she will be able to complete the orders of her regular customers on time.

Arfana hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all of her hard work for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in different colors.

loans.name: Dayana

texts.es:
Dayana es comerciante y vive en la casa de sus padres en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento, en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosi de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja por más de ocho horas al día ya que es el único sustento de ella y su hijo.
Dayana  requiere el crédito para el aumento de su capital; ella vende frazadas, edredones, buzos deportivos en forma  ambulatoria (no tiene lugar fijo de ventas) y desea comprar más de estos artículos para continuar su flujo de ingresos y tal vez hasta mejorarlo..
El sueño de Dayana es terminar sus estudios superiores.Esta es la segunda vez qaue solicita un préstamo a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Dayana is a merchant and lives at her parents’ house, which is made of brick and has cement floors. The house is located in the District of Villa Nuevo Potosi in the city of La Paz. Dayana works more than eight hours day since that is the only way for her to support herself and her child.

She is requesting a loan to increase her capital. Dayana sells blankets, quilts, and sportswear as a street vendor since she has no established retail location. She wants to buy more of these items so that she can continue her revenue flow and even improve it.

Dayana’s dream is to finish her higher education. This is the second time she has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy blankets, quilts, and sportswear to sell.

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es: Don jose de 31 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra maíz y frijol.  Don jose desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Jose is 31 years old.  He is a responsible man with his home obligations since he has always provided the best for his family.  Currently he lives with his wife and their two children.  He is very hard-working and has always done things happily and with enthusiasm.  He works as a farmer who plants corn and beans.  

Jose wants to increase his sales so he is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and other items.  He wants to count on the requested help since he has no other sources of money.  This will allow him to continue providing for his family every day without limitations.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo de 4 años de edad,  es comerciante de frutas y verduras desde hace 2 años eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para poder tener su negocio vende en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues vende a buen precio sus frutas y verduras, la clienta solicita un préstamo para poder comprar plátanos, naranjas, papas, guineos, cebollas, tomates  y todo lo que necesita para acrecentar su negocio y asi tener sus clientes satisfechos cuando la busquen para comprarle sus productos y ella podrá tener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a darle a sus familia una mejor vida.
texts.en: The borrower lives in a house of her own, together with her husband and her son, who is four years old. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for two years, which has given her the experience she needs to have her own business. She has a stand at the market closest to her house. She has many customers because she sells at attractive prices. She asks for a loan in order to buy plantains, oranges, potatoes, bananas, onions, tomatoes, and other fruits and vegetables, which she needs in order to make her business grow. This way, she will be able to meet customer demand and this will increase her profits, enabling her to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Ms Zubaida, a 43-year-old married mother of three children. is motivated to provide for her family. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last five years, offering various items and goods for everyday use. She has good communication skills and a good client list. Her husband is a salesperson in a garment shop, but earns insufficient income to support his family alone.

Zubaida wants to grow her business and so has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a stock of detergents and other grocery items such as grains, oil and flour in large quantities to meet increasing customer demand. She wishes to put part of the revenues toward her children’s education and also increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of detergents and other grocery items such as grains, oil and flour in large quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase and sell natural medicine.

loans.name: Shahla

texts.en:
Ms. Shahla is a 48-year-old woman and the loving mother of four children. She is doing the work of purchasing and selling animals with her husband. She has been doing this work for seven years now. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

Currently, Ms. Shahla requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase one more cow. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Ms. Nadia is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She has been stitching clothes for the past 12 years and is proud to be contributing to her household income. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household along with the educational needs of their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces, etc. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. Nadia hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons and laces

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: Fabian  habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de cómo ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un  crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas como: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. que es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Fabian lives in a house he owns together with his wife and their two children.  He works farming corn and beans.  This is how he earns his living and is able to provide for his household every day.  He farms every year and it is the only way he knows to make a living.  He is a hardworking, honest, and responsible man.  In spite of the conditions in which he lives, which are very humble, he does not stop working and doing the best for his family.

He has decided to request a loan to purchase farming supplies such as manure, poison for plagues, seeds, and other items.  He hopes to have favorable results since he does not have another source of income.  He trusts in God that he will succeed in having an abundant harvest, which will allow him to continue providing for his family every day.

loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, and poison for plagues.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah is married with two children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She says that there are high transportation fees for these items.

Milkah is requesting a Kshs 50,000 loan to boost her retail business.  She will purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat

loans.name: Bordemar Group

texts.es: Bordemar, es un Banco Comunal ubicado en la comuna de Castro, provincia de Chiloé X Región de Chile, en donde sus socios tiene diferentes negocios como lo son la venta de comida típicas, de tejidos hechos por ellos, venta de ropa nueva, y hecha de lana, engorde de animales, siembra de flores, mini supermercados, y taller de perfumes, este taller pertenece a Melisa, quien esta al fondo entre dos mujeres de chaqueta roja y es rubia, es socia de este banco, ella comenzó hace tres años en su negocio, juntando y solicitando a distintas firmas de perfumes que le enviaran muestras, además de solicitar ayuda a aun químico para que pudiera crear su propia fragancia, jamás ha tenido problemas en su negocio, lo que la mantiene muy contenta. Ocupará este crédito en comprar más esencias y además vidrio, está feliz porque sabe que será un excelente ciclo y le irá muy bien con la venta. Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el apoyo incondicional que se le entrega además de poder conocer los distintos rubros en los que también como grupo se apoyan mutuamente y se ayudan así todos podrás salir adelante.
texts.en:
“Bordemar” is a Communal Bank that is located in the municipality of Castro in Chiloé Province, which is located in Region X in Chile. The members engage in different businesses such as selling traditional food, making woven items for others, selling new clothes made of wool, raising livestock, growing flowers, operating mini-markets, and operating a perfume shop.

Melisa has a perfume shop. She is the Communal Bank member who is fair-skinned and seated below the two women wearing red jackets. Melisa started her business three years ago by asking different perfume companies to send her samples. She also requested help with the chemicals she needed to create her own fragrance. Melisa has never experienced problems with her business, so she is very pleased.

She will use this loan to buy more essences and glass. Melisa is happy because she knows she will experience a good loan cycle since she expects to do very well with her sales. What she enjoys most about working with Fondo Esperanza is the unconditional support she has received. She is also able to learn about different trades and receive mutual support from her group. As a result, all of the members are able to help one another move forward.

loans.use: to buy essences and glass for making perfumes.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su esposa, sus dos hijos y suegra,  él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol,  tiene 25 años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, Wilfredo  se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, piensa que aprovechar las oportunidades lo llevaran un paso más adelante del éxito; en la última siembra no obtuvo las ganancias esperadas y esta vez quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso  solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semilla abonos, pesticidas  y fertilizante. Wilfredo tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable, responsable y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena
texts.en: Wilfredo is 42 years old.  He lives with his wife, two daughters, and his mother-in-law.  He cultivates corn and beans and has been engaged in farming for twenty-five years, so he has lots of experience in the trade.  He is known in the area and already has good customers since he produces the best crops and therefore, markets quality products at affordable prices.  In addition, his service is unbeatable.  Wifredo is known to be very friendly and he is an enterprising man with a great desire to get ahead.  He feels that taking advantage of opportunities will take him one step closer to success.  At his last sowing, he didn’t obtain the profits expected and this time he wants to increase production.   However, he needs financial support for this and is requesting a loan that will permit him to purchase seeds, organic fertilizer, pesticides, and fertilizer.  Wilfredo has references attesting to his high moral character, his responsibility, and good payment record.  He is confident that he will be able to pay the debt and at the same time, he will be able to provide his family with a full life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, organic fertilizers, pesticides, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mariano De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariano, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en la agricultura; este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y todo lo necesario para la preparación de la tierra para realizar el cultivo.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar la producción, obtener mayores ingresos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Mariano is requesting a new loan to continue investing in his farming.  It will allow him to purchase fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, insecticide, and do all of the necessary things to prepare the land for planting.

His last loan helped him increase production and earn more income.  His financial situation and his family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, and insecticide.

loans.name: Fredys Arsenio

texts.es:
Fredys, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en el negocio y así obtener ganancias; este le permitirá comprar cerdos, concentrado para  engordarlos y luego venderlos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a crecer y tener todo lo necesario para trabajar; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado, ya que tenemos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fredys is asking for a new loan so that he can continue investing in his business and obtain higher earnings. This loan will allow him to purchase pigs as well as feed in order to fatten them, and then sell them.
The previous credit helped him to grow his business and to have everything he needed to work. His economic conditions and his family's cirsumstances have improved because they now have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Maysa

texts.en:
Maysa is a 29-year-old married woman, the mother of three children. She started working in the beauty business as a hairdresser 15 years ago. She's just like almost all of the Palestinians living in Lebanon; they all start working at an early age to help support their family in making a living and covering their expenses. Palestinians don't have a wide range of working domains to choose; they are limited with certain domains they have to succeed in.

Maysa supports her husband, who works at fixing car flat tires, in their family's financial situation. She works as a hairdresser from her house, and at the same time she works for a hospital in the cleaning department to insure an extra income source for any sudden family need.

Maysa is applying for a Youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy special hair treatment products and tools. She hopes that one day she will be capable of expanding her own business by opening a separate beauty salon and stop the cleaning work, so she can split her time between her own business and family equally.

loans.use: To buy special hair treatment products and tools

loans.name: Besik

texts.en:
Besik is 28 years old. He lives in the Samtredia District with his wife and two children. Besik requested loans from local financial institutions several times for his family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family was his car, as he had worked as a taxi driver. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family. belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Besik requested a loan from Credo to start up his family business. Besik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Besik will fix his car. As the car is fixed, he will continue working as a taxi driver. This will increase income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up Loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to renovate his car and continue working as a taxi driver

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has been working in selling used men's and women's clothes since September 2012. Amal used to work as an accountant, but she wanted to increase her financial support to her family, so that's why she insisted on starting her own business.

Her husband works as a truck driver and earns a very low income, so that's why she works hard to provide him with her support.

She is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy used kid's clothes and sell them for the coming summer season.

She is very optimistic about this loan and has many future plans.

loans.use: To buy used kid's clothes to sell

loans.name: Manuel Tranquilino

texts.es: Don Manuel de 61 años de edad, vive con esposa y su suegra en casa propia, don Manuel es un hombre  trabajador, responsable y muy emprendedor,  desea hace varios años se dedica a la  venta de leche de cabra en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus cabras ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y concentrado  y ajustar para la compra de mas cabras  que le permita crecer en el negocio. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Don Manuel, 61 years old, lives with his wife and mother-in-law in his own home. He is a hardworking, responsible and very entrepreneurial man. For many years he has sold goat’s milk in the area where he resides. He has many good clients because he has known how to gain his customers’ confidence. He offers quality and good prices in his products.

Don Manuel has decided to invest in his goats’ care because his business depends on their well-being. Consequently he has requested a loan in order to buy vitamins and animal feed and allow for the purchase of more goats so that he can expand his business. In this way he hopes to make a profit and to continue providing his household with greatly needed economic help.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and animal feed and allow for the purchase of more goats.

loans.name: Djromahuton Group

texts.fr: DJROMAHUTON est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Sella est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sella est âgée 33 ans. Sella est une veuve et est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Sella vend des sacs depuis dix ans. Sella s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Sella s'associe aux autres membres du groupe DJROMAHUTON pour consentir un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Djromahuton is a group of four people, who live in the same district. The representative of the group, whose name is Sella, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Sella is 33 years old, a widow and mother to six children, who are all at school and in her care. In order to provide for her children's needs, Sella has been selling bags for the past ten years. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. With a view to strengthening her business and satisfying customer demand, Sella has joined forces with the other members of the Djromahuton group to be granted a fourth loan from Alidé. The previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy bags.

loans.name: Mahougnon Evivi Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON EVIVI est un groupe de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Constantine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Constantine est âgée de 35 ans. Constantine est mariée à un certain Ferdinand. Constantine et son mari assurent ensemble les charges familiales. pour ce faire, Constantine vend des friperies depuis six ans. Constantine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Constantine s'est associée aux autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON EVIVI, pour solliciter un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Mahougnon Evivi is a group of three people who live in the same district. The representative of the group, whose name is Constantine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Constantine is 35 years old and married to a man named Ferdinand. She and her husband cover the various family expenses between them. In order to do this, Constantine has been selling second-hand clothing for the past six years. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. With a view to boosting her business and satisfying customer demand, Constantine has got together with the other members of the Mahougnon Evivi group to request a fifth loan from Alidé. The previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children – three of them attend school. She is not looking after any additional family members. She rents a house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Gorret has been selling green bananas and charcoal retail at the market for ten years, working seven days a week. She does not have any additional source of income. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation.

Gorret has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more bunches of green bananas and charcoal for sale. Her dream is to expand her business to a wholesale. She joined MCDT because she had failed to get capital from people, relatives inclusive.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Jimsher

texts.en:
Jimsher is 57 years old. He lives in Akhaltsikhe District with his wife and son. Jimsher requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up but without any success. His loan requests are rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Jimsher requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Jimsher has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Jimsher will purchase calves. After purchasing calves, he will raise them, and after they are grown they will produce dairy products. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La señora, Maria es habitante de la comarca llamada La Bogoña del Municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo lucha dia a dia para salir adelante y cumplir su  mayor sueño, terminar su casa de habitacion, ella labora como docente en un  colegio Privado, su esposo es chofer para una empresa Privada, entre los dos se dividen los gastos del hogar, actualmente doña Maria esta esperando a su primer bebe, por lo que le urge darle los ultimos retoque a su casa, con este credito compra los siguientes Materiales: Arena, Cemento, Ceramica  y Ventanas, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic le ha brindado y ha Fondos Kiva por la confianza.
texts.en:
María is a resident of the La Borgoña rural community in the municipality of Ticuantepe. Together with her husband, she struggles from day to day to get by and realize her greatest dream: to complete construction of her residence. 

María works as a teacher in a private school, and her husband is a driver for a private company. They divide the household costs between them. María is currently expecting her first baby, so she is eager to give her house its finishing touches. With this loan, she will buy the following materials: sand, cement, tile, and windows. 

She is grateful to Afodenic for the support they have given her and to Kiva for their trust in her.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su compañero de vida en cas propia. La clienta posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: , agua embotellada y otros productos más. Ella es una persona muy responsable y amable la cual cuenta con varios clientes a pesar que su tienda no tiene mucha variedad de productos. La clienta solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, ya que el mayor deseo de ella es el de poder surtir su negocio y así percibir mayores ganancias. La clienta es un mujer muy responsable quien desea mucho poder brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: The borrower lives with her husband in their own home. The borrower has a store where she sells basic necessities, such as bottled water and other products. She is a very responsible and friendly person who has a variety of customers even though her store doesn't have a wide variety of products. She is requesting a loan so that she will have the money necessary for purchasing products wholesale because her main desire is to be able to stock up her business and so have better revenue. The borrower is a very responsible woman who very much wants to give the best to her family.

loans.use: purchase bread, milk, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Simon De Jesus

texts.es: Don Simón es un hombre trabajador y responsable con las obligaciones que le corresponden, vive en casa propia con su familia, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como: maíz, fríjol, entre otros lleva ya muchos años de experiencia en esta rama de la agricultura con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Don simón  solicita un crédito  para la compra de insumos agrícolas como lo son: fertilizantes, semilla, abonos, etc. Para que la cosecha sea de gran provecho y no se pierda nada del producto y asi obtener más ganancias que le ayudaran a darle a su familia lo que necesite sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Simón is a working and responsible man with the obligations that go along with living in his own home with his family. He farms basic grains such as corn, beans, etc. and has many years of experience in this field of agriculture. With the revenues he generates from his sales, he covers some of his household expenses. Simón is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, compost, etc. so that the harvest will be bountiful and he won't lose any of the product, and so he will be able to have better revenue to use to give his family whatever they need without holding back.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, seeds, compost, etc.

loans.name: Nonvitcha Group

texts.fr: NONVITCHA est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Rachel est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Rachel est âgée de 30 ans. Rachel est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Raymond. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et a leur charge. Rachel et son mari assurent ensemble les charges de familles. Pour ce faire, Rachel vend des friperies depuis huit ans de façon ambulante. Rachel s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Rachel s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe NONVITCHA pour solliciter un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Nonvitcha is a group of four people who live in the same district. The representative of the group, whose name is Rachel, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Rachel is 30 years old and married to a retailer named Raymond. The couple has three children, who are all at school and in their care. Rachel and her husband cover the various family expenses between them. In order to do this, Rachel has been selling second-hand clothing on a door-to-door basis for the past eight years. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. With a view to boosting her business and satisfying customer demand, Rachel has got together with the other members of the Nonvitcha group to request a fourth loan from Alidé. The previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, vegetable oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Angel Norberto

texts.es:
Ángel tiene 33 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad vive con el hijo en la ciudad de Gauranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la Ventanilla  Los pinos, se encuentra formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad, se dedican a la agricultura queda a 40 minutos de la oficina Comunidad Pangua.
Ángel  es chofer profesional, se dedica  a la siembra de maíz, trigo, además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, ganado. Solicita el crédito para comprar un puesto de taxi en el centro. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar y poder trabajar para tener ingresos para el bienestar del hijo.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es combatir la pobreza. El sueño es tener puesto seguro y mejorar la economía.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte en especial el boly.
texts.en:
Ángel is 33 years old, single, and has a 10-year-old son. He lives with his son in the city of Gauranda in the province of Bolivar.

He is a member of the Ventanilla los Pinos communal bank, which is formed of 14 members who are from the same community. They work in agriculture and live about 40 minutes from the Pangua Community office.

Ángel is a professional chauffeur, he also plants corn, wheat, and raises pigs and cattle. He is requesting this loan to purchase a taxi cab in the city. With the help of this loan he will be able to purchase (a cab) and be able to work in order to have income to support the well-being of his son.

The challenge he faces is combating poverty. His dream is to have a secure job and improve his economic situation.

In his free time, he likes to play sports, especially ball.

loans.use: purchase a taxi cab in the city.

loans.name: Zoila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Zoila, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para invertir en el negocio de crianza de cerdos; este le permitirá comprar cerdos y concentrado para engordarlos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener más ingresos; las condiciones económicas han mejorado mientras que las circunstancias familiares se mantienen.
texts.en:
The need arises for Zoila to take out a new loan so that she can invest in her pig-raising business. This will allow her to buy pigs, and feed concentrate for fattening them.

The previous loan helped her to increase her inventory and obtain more income. Her economic situation has improved, while her family circumstances remain the same.

loans.use: To buy pigs and feed concentrate for fattening them.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Josephine sells fruits and vegetables from a stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Maria Zoila

texts.es:
María tiene 49 años de edad es soltera tiene tres hijos, vive en casa de unos familiares con los hijos en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla  Los pinos, se encuentra formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad, se dedican a la agricultura queda a 40 minutos de la oficina Comunidad Pangua.

María se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales a la siembra de papas, maíz y cría pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado, vacuna, alimentación. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta.

La compra la efectuara en la ciudad de Guaranda. El sueño es realizar arreglos para agrandar y mejorar la casa. Los desafíos  a los que se enfrenta es combatir a todos los problemas que se le presenten . En el tiempo libre le gusta ir de paseo, y visitar a los familiares lejanos.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old, single, and has three children. She and her children live in the home of one of her family members in the city of Guaranda, in the province of Bolivar.

She is a member of the Ventanilla los Pinos communal bank, which is formed of 14 members who are all from the same community. They work in agriculture and live 40 minutes from the Pangua Community office.

María works in agriculture, raising animals and planting potatoes, corn, and raising chickens and pigs. She is requesting the loan to purchase livestock, vaccines, and feed. With the help of the loan, she will be able to purchase what she is currently lacking.

She will make the purchase in the city of Guaranda. Her dream is to get things in order to add on to and improve her home. The challenge that she faces is combating all the problems that she is presented with. In her free time, she likes to go for walks and visit her family members who are far away.

loans.use: purchase livestock, vaccines, and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of looking after his four children. He has been in the produce business for the last nine years; he got capital from farming. Inadequate capital to purchase stock hinders his business, while his dream is to educate his children and expand his business to new markets. Geofrey intends to use the loan to buy produce such as beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La Sra. Paulina tiene 43 años,  tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, ella se dedica al crianza de ganado y al comercio de del mismo,  comercializa sus productos en la comunidad de Batallas,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Paulina va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ganado su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere  tener más ganado ya que esta época es de mucha demanda, La Sra. Paulina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el clima el tener que transportar el ganado a los distintos puntos de venta,  pero ella tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad con la que trata a su clientela y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo para mejorar su ganado,  
Su deseo para su negocio es tener un negocio estable y rentable y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Paulina is 43 years old. She has three grown children. She raises livestock and sells them. She sells her products in the community of Batallas. This is her first loan through this institution. Paulina is going to use this loan to purchase livestock. Her reason for requesting this loan is that she wants to have more livestock because there is a lot of demand at this time. Paulina faces challenges in her business, such as the climate and having to transport the livestock to certain places for sale. She has, however, many customers because of the friendly manner with which she treats her customers, and she is going to use the profits to purchase fodder, which should be purchased at a certain time to improve her livestock.

Her goal for her business is to have a stable and profitable business, thereby increasing her revenues.

loans.use: purchase livestock

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Abla is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She has been working in selling home products since 2005. She helps her husband in making their living and providing their small family a happy life. Her husband is a Poclain excavator driver with a low income. 

She is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy a car that will make her work easier. She will decrease the transportation expenses for others who take her to the wholesale market, and will try her best to take her children in her free time on small tours around the villages to let them enjoy the beautiful landscape around them.

She will also invest in the car in another way; she will let her husband drive it as a taxi in his free time, too, to make sure that they are benefiting from it in a well managed way.

Abla hopes to keep on developing her business and to keep on making her children's small dreams come true.

loans.use: To buy a car necessary to improve her business and living.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a married woman with seven children, four of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mariamu operates a food making business, making staples like beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. With the 45,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Vitore

texts.en:
Vitore is reapplying for a loan through Kiva to stock up on clothing inventory for the summer season. 

The following is what Vitore said when interviewed by the loan officer. "I just wanted to thank every lender who supported me and has supported others. I deeply appreciate their kindness that lifts our spirits and encourages us to continue our journey, and nothing changes that. This is what I experienced myself. Thank you all again for your kind gestures."

loans.use: To buy clothing inventory for the summer season.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine has been involved in agriculture for 10 years. She cultivates tomatoes and grows peach, apricot and plum trees. Armine sells the gathered harvest in the local market and receives income which is vital for her in sustaining her family of five: Armine herself, her husband, and three children. 

Unfortunately, Armine has no financial means for expanding her farm, so she has applied for the loan from SEF International. The loan will enable her to purchase fertilizer and cover cultivation costs. As the harvesting season has already started, it is very important for Armine to cover cultivation costs and gather more of the harvest.

Armine works hard to ensure a better life for her family and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Aba did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Aba sells fruit in Edukuma (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 10 years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have six children. 

Aba uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Aba will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of fruit, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Aba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fruit, which will aid her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Bertha Adilia

texts.es: Doña Bertha, desde muchos años ha estado vendiendo ropa cosméticos entre otros en su casa y de manera ambulante, ella busca como salir adelante junto a sus hijos y con la ayuda de su esposo, quien continúa  trabajando como albañil. Bertha necesita invertir en su negocio para ofrecer variedad a sus cliente de esa manera garantizar la venta del día para poder pagar los gastos de colegio de sus hijos, como planes futuro desea empezar a mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar para vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Bertha has been selling clothing, cosmetics, and other items for many years, both in her house and on the street. With the help of her husband, who continues to work in construction, she is trying to make a living for herself and her children. 

Bertha needs to invest in her business so she can offer variety to her customers. This will ensure daily sales so she can pay for the educational expenses of her children. 

In the future, she hopes to begin to improve the infrastructure of her home in order to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, and shoes.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a widow with children who are all adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mariam has operated a food stall business from home for the past ten years, selling to passersby and neighbors. She cites seasonality and theft as her challenges. With this 15,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat. Her dream is to expand her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Jedidah

texts.en:
Jedidah is a married woman staying together with her husband and three children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to be a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the village. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a widow and has been blessed with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Nelly operates a fruits and vegetables stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, such as oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits such as oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling pineapples in Edukuma (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 12 years. Aba is married and has 5 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. 

Aba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of pineapple. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current fruit inventory levels

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Even though Gladys grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Gladys is an entrepreneur. She sells cooked rice in Bogyano (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began three years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their two children. 

Gladys has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more rice to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladys wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides, among other supplies.

loans.name: Nderagakura Group

texts.fr:
Chantal fait partie du groupe  Nderagakura  et   habite à Gitega. Elle a 32ans et est mariée à Cyriaque, un maçon. Ensemble, ils ont 3 enfants  âgés de 4 à  7 ans dont 1 étudie.

Elle  fait le commerce de bière de banane et elle est tailleur.

Elle  est à son  huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de fil,de vaseline,... pour la confection de plus d’habits des clients ; et  augmenter la quantité de bananes pour la préparation de la bière de banane à revendre,  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Chantal is a member of the Nderagakura group and lives in Gitega. She is 32 years old and married to Cyriaque, a stonemason. Together they have three children ranging from four to seven years of age, one of whom is in school.
She sells  banana beer and also works as a seamstress.
She is on her eighth loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, she will bolster her capital and stock up on thread, sewing machine lubricant etc in order to sew more outfits for her customers as well as increase her stock of bananas to prepare beer for sale, thus increasing her revenues.

loans.use: to bolster her capital and stock up on thread, sewing machine lubricant etc in order to sew more outfits for her customers as well as increase her stock of bananas to prepare beer for sale, thus increasing her revenues.

loans.name: Patmabaim

texts.en:
Patmabaim is 64 years old. She lives in a small village in the Bolnisi district with her husband. Patmabaim requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up but without any success. Her loan requests are rejected all the time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 0.2 hectares of land where haricot [beans] are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Patmabaim requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Patmabaim has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit, Patmabaim will purchase milking cows. After purchasing milking cows, she will be able to produce dairy products to sell at local markets. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Frederik

texts.en:
Frederik is a 27-year-old hard worker and married father of a 1-year-old child who lives in the rural south central Albania with his family. He is the only one to provide financially for his family, yet this makes him happy according to him. “I love to help financially and other ways. I feel in charge. Having money is always good, but at the same time for poor people like me, it remains a dream; so we are happy with as little as we make or have…” Frederik said, smiling.

Frederik has been in the construction industry for the past 10 years, and he expresses his gratitude for having this opportunity to make some money. In addition to it, he takes care of some goats he has and sells fresh dairy products to locals.

The loan that Frederik is applying for now is to build a stable for his goats.

loans.use: To build a stable for his goats.

loans.name: Suliko

texts.en:
Suliko is 40 years old. He lives in Batumi District with his wife and son. His daughter is married and lives with her husband. Suliko had been living in Samtredia District, but the family decided to sell everything there and resettle in Batumi. Nowadays, his wife works as a cleaner at a local school in Batumi. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Suliko requested a loan from Credo to finance the start-up costs for a new family business. Suliko has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people and businesses. 

With his credit, Suliko will purchase a minibus. After purchasing a minibus, he will be able to work on a minibus line transporting people. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus to work on a minibus line

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Though she has received no formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fruit in Edukuma (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 8 years. 

Ama is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business help cover the family’s general expenses and pay the children’s school fees. 

Ama will use this loan to purchase more fruit, thus improving her overall sales. With the profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells to adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit, thus improving her overall sales

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Although he has received no prior formal education, Zakaria is an entrepreneur. He works as a taxi driver in Edukuma (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for 5 years. Zakaria is married and has 5 children. His wife works as a business woman. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

He wants to use his loan to expand his business. In the long term, Zakaria plans to reinvest future profits into his business, thus helping him expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more poultry batches and number of chicks per batch; that is, from 150 to 250 per batch.

loans.name: Nonvitcha 2 Group

texts.fr: NONVITCHA 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Hélène est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Hélène est âgée de 40 ans. Hélène a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Hélène est mariée à un certain Denis. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Hélène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour ce faire, Hélène vend des friperies depuis deux ans. Hélène s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Hélène s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe NONVITCHA 2 pour consentir un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Nonvitcha 2 is a group of three members living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, by the name of Hélène, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Hélène is 40 years old. She stopped attending school at the secondary level. Her husband’s name is Denis. They have three dependent children, all in school. Hélène lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for household needs. In order to do so, Hélène has been selling used clothing for two years. She stocks up at a market in Benin. With the goal of strengthening her business and meeting customer demand, Hélène has joined forces with the other members of the Nonvitcha 2 group in order to obtain a fifth loan from ALIDé. Their prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Nurkhon

texts.ru:
Нурхон замужем. Ей 45 лет. Нурхон имеет двоих детей. Она со своей семьей живет в городе Турсунзаде в центрально-западной части страны. Муж Нурхон находится на заработках за пределами страны. Дети учатся в школе. 
У Нурхон среднее образование. Она занимается вышиванием национальных таджикских одеял. Нурхон в этой области занята 7 лет. Она берет кредит для закупа ткани для вышивания одеял. В дальнейшем Нурхон за счет дохода от деятельности планирует купить швейную машинку для дочери. Она хочет обучить дочь вышиванию и передать ей свое ремесло.
texts.en:
Nurkhon is married. She is 45 years old. She has two children. She lives with her family in the town of Tursun-zoda, in the central western part of Tajikistan. Nurkhon’s husband works as a migrant worker outside the country. Her children attend secondary school.
Nurkhon has received secondary education. She works embroidering traditional Tajik blankets. She has been working in this business for seven years. She is taking out a loan in order to buy fabric for making embroidered blankets. In the future, she would like to use her business revenues to buy an additional sewing machine for her daughter. She would like to teach embroidery to her daughter, who would then continue this business.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Even though Ama grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. 

Currently, Ama is an entrepreneur. She sells pineapples in Edukuma (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 10 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their six children. 

Ama has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Unfortunately, she is unable to meet these needs due to limited inventory capacity. Therefore, she plans to use her loan to purchase more pineapples to sell. With the profits from her expanded business, Ama wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more pineapples to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Esi sells pineapples in Edukuma (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for a number of years now. As a single mother with 3 children, Esi uses all her income to feed and provide for her family.

She will use the loan to purchase an increased number of pineapples, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased number of pineapples, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Sada

texts.en:
Sada is a married woman and stays together with her husband and seven children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a vegetable selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale grocery in the village. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase a stock of tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Even though Zenabu grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Zenabu is an entrepreneur. She sells pineapples in Edukuma (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 5 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their 4 children. 

She has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. However, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited capacity for inventory. She aims to use her loan to purchase more pineapples to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Zenabu wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more pineapples to sell.

loans.name: Yadira De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Yadira  habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, madre soltera, trabajdora y esmerada su mayor sueño e spoder  mejorar de condiciones y darle a su hijo un mejor futuro, ella es comerciante desde hace mas de 3 años vende Ropa nueva y de segunda, con este credito que se le ha otorgado comprara Paca de Ropa y una de Zapatos ya que sus clientes le piden que venda zapatos, con esto espera que su negocio crezca y obtenga mejores ingresos, Agradece el que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en: Yadira lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother, hardworking, and  conscientious. Her greatest dream is to improve her conditions and give her son a better future. She has been a merchant for more than three years. She sells new and used clothing. With the loan she has been granted she will buy one bale of clothing and one of shoes, since her clients are asking her to sell shoes. With this she hopes her business will grow and that she will improve her income. She appreciates that Afodenic and Kiva have provided her support.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en: After graduating Middle School, Kwadwo decided to set up his own pineapple business in Edukuma (near Cape Coast). With over 2 years worth of experience, he is currently looking to expand his enterprise further. Unfortunately, he is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help him by purchase more pineapples for resale. He aims at using the profits from his business to help support his wife (who is a farmer) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their 9 children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help him purchase more pineapples for resale.

loans.name: Joel Antonio

texts.es: Joel de 33 años de edad  se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol , comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con su esposa, sus dos hijos y su suegra,  Joel  esta solicitando un crédito para poder comparar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir dándole lo que necesita su familia sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
Joel is 33 years old. He has been working in agriculture for the past 20 years. This experience has given him the skills and knowledge he needs to look after his crops. He sows mainly maize and beans. He sells his crops to agencies in his locality that trade in staple grains. The money he makes from these sales covers some of his family’s bills. He lives in his own home with his wife, two children and his mother-in-law. 

Joel is requesting a loan to be able to buy agricultural supplies, such as manure, seeds and fertilisers, which help him when he is sowing his crops. He hopes that this will increase his earnings and in that way he can continue to provide for his family’s needs without difficulty.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and fertilisers, etc.

loans.name: Harlan Jose

texts.es: El señor Harlan habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa e hijo, sus planes a futuro es terminar de Construir su casa ya que ellos quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida, el es comerciante de Ropa y Zapatos, al igual que su esposa ellos comparten los gastos del  hogar, el actualmente tiene mucha demanda en su negocio ya que el vende ropa para Hombres y cada dia sus clientes  le exigen mas, agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le estan proporcionando mediante este credito ya que podra comprar Ropa nueva y de segunda y un paca de zapatos usados.
texts.en: Harlan lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe, along with his wife and child. Their plans for the future are to finish building their house because they want to improve their living conditions. He is a merchant selling clothing and shoes, and so is his wife. They share the household expenses. His business currently has a lot of demand because he sells men's clothing and each day his clients demand more. He is grateful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva have provided him through this loan, since he will be able to buy new and used clothing and a pack of used shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, and two of them attend school. She is not looking after any other family member. She has been operating a small eating-place (restaurant) for the last 3 years, working seven days a week. She does not have an additional source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock green bananas, rice, beans, peas and spices. Her challenges include limited capital. Her dream is to own a big restaurant. She joined MCDT for start-up capital. She rents a house without either electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more beans, peas, spices, rice and  green bananas.

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
Even though Kwaku grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped him from fulfilling his dream of achieving a better life for himself and his family. Currently, Kwaku is an entrepreneur. He sells pineapples in Edukuma (near Cape Coast). His business enterprise has grown substantially since he began 10 years ago. He uses the income from his business to help his wife raise their 4 children. 

Kwaku has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for his product. However, he is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory. Thus he aims to use his loan to purchase more pineapples to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwaku wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all his children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more pineapples to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Paul did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped him from achieving his dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Paul sells bush meat in Edukuma (near Cape Coast). He has been doing so for about 6 years. He is married to a trader, and together they have 4 children. Paul uses all his income to feed and provide for his family. 

Paul will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of bush meat, which will aid him in improving his overall sales. Paul wants to use the future profits from his expanded business to ensure that all his children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of bush meat, which will aid him in improving his overall sales.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda is a 33-year-old married woman with four children. They live in a poor area in Haja, Yemen. She is a housewife who works hard to provide her family. Her children like to watch child-friendly channels on the television. She doesn't have money to buy a television, so she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a television for her children to use. She hopes to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a television for her children to use

loans.name: Maweu

texts.en:
Maweu is married, and her husband is a teacher. They live in their own home that doesn't have electricity or piped water. Their greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She cites theft and competition as her major challenges in the business. 

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy sacks of coconuts for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale coconut shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Roberto Abilio

texts.es:
Roberto, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio; este le permitirá comprar productos de primera necesidad tales como: frijoles, arroz, aceite, huevos, azúcar, entre otros productos.
El crédito anterior le permitió crecer en los inventarios y tener más surtido el negocio; las circunstancias familiares y las condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Roberto is requesting a new loan as he needs to invest more in his business. This will enable him to buy basic goods, such as beans, rice, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, and so on.

With his last loan he was able to increase his level of inventory and to have a wider range of stock for the business. Both his family and economic situations have improved.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, and so on

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Though he has received no formal education, Kofi is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling pineapples in Edukuma (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for a number of years. 

Kofi is married and has 9 children. His wife works as a farmer. The proceeds from his business help cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Kofi wants to use his loan to purchase more pineapples to sell, increasing his current inventory levels and allowing him to sell greater quantities of pineapples. 

In the long term, Kofi plans to reinvest future profits into his business, thus helping him expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase more pineapples to sell

loans.name: Agasin

texts.en:
