Agasin is 31 years old. He lives in Marneuli District with his wife. Agasin requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is their the agricultural activities. In particular, they have 0.5 hectare of land, where they grow potatoes and tomatoes. They sell the harvested products locally. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Agasin requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Agasin has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up Loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credit, with soft conditions, to rural poor people who do not have access to other credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit Agasin will purchase calves. After purchasing calves, he and his wife will raise them and, in the future, they will produce dairy products to sell. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up Loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise for dairy

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and, together with her husband, she lives at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. For years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations, in her business. 

With the KES 40,000 she is borrowing, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Efua did not have access to any formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Efua sells pineapple in Edukuma, near Cape Coast. She has been doing so for about four years. She is married to a taxi driver and together they have five children. Efua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family.

Efua will use this loan to purchase more pineapples which will help improve her overall sales. Efua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more pineapples

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mary has a business selling fish. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other fish sellers in her business. With this 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase more bundles of fish for resale, as the demand is rising high. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of fish for resale as the demand is rising high.

loans.name: Yaa Yaa

texts.en:
Even though Yaa Yaa grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Yaa Yaa is an entrepreneur. She sells fruit in Edukuma, near Cape Coast. Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began three years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their five children.

Yaa Yaa has identified growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more fruit to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa Yaa wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén, solicita un nuevo préstamo por lo que estos son un recurso importante para poder salir adelante;  este le permitirá comprar concentrado para el ganado, pago de mano de  obra para limpiar media manzana de tierra en la que sembrara maíz y frijol, asimismo adquirir los insumos agrícolas tales como:  abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar la  ganadería; tambien las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Rubén is requesting a new loan because loans are an important resource for getting ahead. It will allow him to buy feed for his livestock and to pay for manual labor to clear half a hectare of land where he will plant corn and beans. He will also purchase fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, fungicides, and other agricultural supplies.

The previous loan helped him to increase his livestock; his economic condition and his family's circumstances have also improved.

loans.use: to buy feed for livestock and to pay for labor, fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, fungicides,  and other supplies.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fruit in Edukuma, near Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. Abena is married and has seven children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

Abena will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of fruit, thus, aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence, adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fruit, thus, aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justin lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which lies in the central Rift Valley. He has four children. He has been farming for 20 years.  His primary income sources are eggs, tea, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming:  The income he gets which helps him to provide for his family.  His biggest challenge is the unreliable weather conditions. Animals on the farm have not been given names.

Justin was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied:  'Because Juhudi Kilimo is giving loans with very favourable terms.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session, and he said:  'Microfinance can help small-scale farmers to acquire assets.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family,' Justin said that he will be able to educate his children and to upgrade the family's living standard.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Justin owns the following:  poultry, pump, bicycle.  He does not own:  cow, pig, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household:  mosquito net, running water, TV.  He does not have electricity, solar power, sewing machine, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchasa a dairy cow

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Adjoa did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Adjoa sells pineapple in Edukuma (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about eight years. 

As a single mother with two children, Adjoa uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of pineapple, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Adjoa wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of pineapple

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fruit in Edukuma, near Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. Ama is married and has two children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

Ama wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence, allowing her to sell greater quantities of fruit. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus, helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is single and has three children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Rebecca is a successful businesswoman. She sells cooking ingredients and fish in Edukuma (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about six months. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Rebecca uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Rebecca will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish and cooking ingredients, which will help her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rebecca plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish and cooking ingredients, thus improving her overall sales

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Abena did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Abena sells pineapples and groceries in Edukuma (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about eight years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have two children. Abena uses all her income to feed and provide for her family.

Abena will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of pineapples and groceries, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. She wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of pineapple and groceries

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own home that doesn't have electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He has operated a grocery business for the past five years, selling at the market to market dwellers and passersby. He cites seasonality to be his major challenge, and dreams of expanding his business and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the 30,000 KES loan, he will purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, onions to sell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, onions

loans.name: Oscar Vidal

texts.es:
Oscar, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de maíz y otro tipo de siembra; este le permitirá comprar abono, pesticidas, herbicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar las ganancias y con ello logro adquirir lo necesario para la siembra; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Oscar is requesting a new loan because of his need for more working capital to continue investing in his corn crops and other plantings. This will allow him to buy fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, insecticides, and other supplies.

His previous loan helped him to increase his earnings, with which he managed to buy what he needed for planting his crops. His economic conditions and his family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, insecticides and other supplies.

loans.name: Maku

texts.en:
Maku is married to a businessman. Together they have three children, all of whom attend school. They live in their own home that doesn't have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a charcoal business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She cites theft and the high cost of transportation as her major challenges in the business. 

Maku is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
For the past two years, Lilian has operated a retail shop business where she sells household consumables such as wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil. She cites theft and competition as her major challenges in the business. 

Lilian is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat in order to boost her retail business. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from Harzhis village of Syuniq region, which is one of the coldest regions and is famous for its severe cold climate. The best agricultural business for the locals is cattle farming and some limited land cultivation. Anahit keeps one mother pig, eight little pigs, 40 chickens and 25 colonies of bees. She also owns a plot of agricultural land where she cultivates wheat and potato as well as grows nut, pear and apple trees.

Unfortunately, Anahit has insufficient funds to purchase forage and feed the livestock. Therefore, she has requested a loan from SEF International to purchase forage and also two mother pigs and five little pigs. The loan will help her to enlarge her agricultural activity and make more income, which is very important for sustaining this family of five: Anahit herself, her husband and three children.

loans.use: to pay for two mother pigs, five little pigs and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is a music teacher with many years of experience, teaching at local school. She lives in Goris town, with her husband and 24-year-old son. Unfortunately, a teacher's salary is hardly enough for covering a family's basic costs, and engaging in a farming business helps Larisa to have stable income. Together with her husband, Larisa keeps 45 chickens, 5 turkey and 80 colonies of bees. They get agricultural products (eggs and honey) and sell them locally.
 
Because the agricultural business is an important source of her family's income, Larisa would like to expand it. She has applied for this loan to SEF International, in order to enlarge her agricultural activities. With the loan's help she will be able to purchase fertilizer and seeds, and to cover fuel costs for transporting the gathered harvest to the market. It is very important for Larisa to gather more agricultural income and ensure a better life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds, and fuel for transporting the harvest

loans.name: Paulus

texts.en:
Paulus is a 58-year-old retired man married to Magdalena, a 55-year-old housewife. They are blessed with five children: Yeni, 31 years old; Veni, 28 years old (both are civil servants and married); Hilda, 25 years old and in college; Irenius, 20 years old and a police officer; and the last one is Petra, 16 years old and graduated from senior high school.

To generate more income, Paulus employs two people as ojek (motorcycle taxi drivers). The income from the business enables him to save some money for his daughter's education fees. Now, Paulus is seeking a loan to finance Hilda's registration fees for a new semester. Therefore, he requested a loan of 5,000,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiah) from TLM.

loans.use: to finance his daughter's semester fees.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a 47-year-old married man with six children living in Masindi, Uganda.He practices farming and earns a salary as a parish chief of a sub county. Unpredictable weather changes and poor working conditions pose a challenge to the realization of his dreams. His desire is to venture into modern commercial agriculture and pay school fees for his children to attain degrees as minimum qualification. Amos intends to use this loan to pay for labor to weed his garden.

loans.use: to pay for labor to weed his garden.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 58 years old and married to Petrus, 72, who is retired. They have been blessed with three children, namely, Agustinus, 25, a student in college; Regina, 24, a midwife; and Paulinus, 20, a motorcycle taxi driver.
 
Rosalia is a retired midwife. In order to generate more income, she started a kiosk business selling daily need products. She has been running this business for four years. At the moment, Rosalia needs money for her daughter’s school practical fees. She has requested a loan amount of IDR 6,000,000 from TLM. She is hoping TLM is willing to provide a loan for her.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's school practical fees

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.en:
Sebastiana is a 50-year-old married mother of five children. She is married to Yosef, a 62-year-old retired teacher.

Sebastiana and Yosef bought 52 acres of paddy lands last year. They are hard-working farmers. Recently, they harvested 500 kg of rice, selling the rice for IDR 8,000/kg. The income generated has been spent on their children's educational fees. 

Sebastiana now has to buy insecticide and seedling. Therefore, she has requested a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to purchase insecticide and seedling

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Maria, 59 años de edad, casada, habitante de la ciudad de Managua, madre de 8 hijos, todos mayores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, perfumes y zapatos. Sus inicios en el mundo laboral fue desde los 12 años de edad cuando trabajaba como domesticas limpiando y planchando, después trabajo en una empresa como obrera dejo de trabajar ahí y con la liquidación decidió dedicarse a la crianza y venta de cerdos siempre con el objetivo de sacar adelante a sus hijos. Después se dedicó a vender cosméticos cuando recibió una charla sobre venta de maquillaje poco a poco fue comprando otros productos tales como ropa, perfumes y joyas de plata . Tiene 5 años con esta actividad que realiza de manera ambulante ofrece de casa en casa , empresas, fábricas  y clientes de su vecindario. 
Hoy está necesitando el crédito para comprar ropa y perfumes para vender sobre todo que está cerca la celebración del día de la madre. Ella desea poner una tienda de mercadería variedades, su meta próxima es comprar una vitrina para exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old and married. She is a resident of the city of Managua and the mother of eight children, who are all adults. She earns her living selling clothing, perfumes, and shoes. 

She got her start in the working world at the age of twelve, when she worked as a domestic employee, cleaning and ironing. Later, she worked in a business as a laborer. She stopped working there and with her severance, she decided to earn her living raising and selling pigs, always with the objective of providing for her children. 

Later, after hearing a talk on selling makeup, she worked selling cosmetics. Little by little, she began purchasing other products like clothing, perfumes, and jewelry. She has been in this business for five years; she sells from door to door at homes, businesses, factories, and to other neighborhood customers.

At this time, she needs a loan to purchase clothing and perfumes to sell, mainly because the Mother's Day celebration is approaching. She wants to set up a shop selling a variety of merchandise; her short-term goal is to buy a display case to exhibit her products.

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfumes.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima, a 48-year-old teacher, is married to Laurensius, a 48-year-old driver. They have five children: Ani, 21, a student at university; Esti, 16, a senior high school student; two junior high school students, Roni, 14, and Donatus, 13; and Ega, 8 years old, an elementary school student.

They have a minivan operating in the village every day. At the moment, Maxima is seeking loan assistance to repair the minivan and pay her children's education fees. Therefore, she requested a loan amount of IDR 12,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to repair the minivan and pay her children's education fees

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en: Fridah is a 39-year-old married woman with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop in which she sells general merchandise, and she also rears cows for additional income. Her business is located on a highway, thus travelers are her major clients. Stiff competition and theft have posed a challenge to her business growth, while her plans are to acquire secure premises and trade in wholesale. Fridah intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise, such as soap and sugar, to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as soap and sugar, to sell.

loans.name: Sarai

texts.en:
Sarai is a 39 year old married woman with 3 children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro,bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Sarai has requested a loan to buy grass sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer and a wheelbarrow for her business.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Sarai hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy grass sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas has requested $1500 to improve her business. She has an electronic repair shop with many customers every day. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies of electronic equipment, glass cabinets, and tools. She has been involved in this business since 2010. She feels very comfortable running her business because she is able to earn money every day.

Running a business has made Domingas independent so that she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy electronic equipment and glass cabinet

loans.name: Terecia

texts.en:
Terecia is taking a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2002 with her own working capital of $400.00. 

Terecia is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, biscuits and other items.

loans.name: Natividad  De Jesus

texts.es: Don Natividad de la edad de 37 años edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 7 hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de arroz desde hace 20  años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados de granos basicos con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Don natividad  solicita un credito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, entre otras cosas para tener buenas cosechas y asi el pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
Natividad is 37 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their seven children. He has earned his living growing rice for twenty years, and that has given him the experience he needs to tend his crops. He sells his harvests in the staple grains markets; with the earnings he gets for his sales, he manages to cover his household costs. 

Natividad is requesting a loan so that he can buy the supplies he needs (like fertilizers, herbicides, soil amendments, and others) to have good harvests and make greater profits in order to give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, soil amendments, etc.

loans.name: Yosep

texts.en:
Yosep is a 50-year-old married man. From his marriage with Aqualina, who is 36 years old, they are blessed with five children: Godenfridus is 19 years old and a worker; Edo is 9 years old and Anjani is 7 years old, and both are in elementary school; Raimundus is 5 years old and attends kindergarten; and Gilberto, who is 2 years old.

Yosep has been working as a teacher since 1993. In order to earn more income, Yosef is raising piglets to sell. He wants to improve his business. Therefore, he applied for a loan of 10,000,000 IDR with TLM. He plans to spend the loan on the materials for the pig stall, piglets, and chicks.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a pig stall, piglets, and chicks.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en: Mathias is a 39-year-old hardworking married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a motorcycle for a transport business, and with the proceeds he has been able to start a spare parts shop after realizing the ready market available. Inadequate capital and customers not paying on time affect the business, while his dream is to trade in wholesale and import new motorcycles to sell. Mathias intends to use the loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Badralt

texts.en:
Mr. Badralt is a 42 year old micro-entrepreneur who lives with his wife Tsevelmaa and 3 children in a rental apartment in the Orhon province of Mongolia.

His wife, two daughters and his son all are very supportive of him and help him to run their family business. He has graduated from school in Russia and worked in various fields since. He has just bought a plot of land and built a greenhouse to grow organic vegetables and has also started operating an organic bakery production on his land in August 2012. He took baking classes and courses. He is a passionate, strict and hardworking man who needs an additional investment of 7,000,000MNT to purchase seeds for his organic vegetable plantation and to pay for packaging for his organic bakery production.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for his organic vegetable plantation and to pay for packaging for his organic bakery production

loans.name: Jardemgul

texts.en:
Mrs. Jardemgul is a 27 year old woman who lives with her husband and two sons in a small house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. She stays at home taking care of their five year old and eight month old new born son. Her husband runs a transportation service business within their town using a rental van. 

He has been operating this transportation service within their town and between cities with this particular van for two years and now the owner of the van is selling it. Mrs. Jardemgul's husband is planning to buy the van and officially run the business with his own van. She is requesting 3,500,000MNT to purchase the van to let her husband to continue his transportation service. Both the borrower and her husband are hardworking people.

loans.use: to purchase a van to let her husband continue his transportation service

loans.name: Efren

texts.en: Efren is married with 5 children. Efren is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He has owned and operated a banana farm for 10 years and earns 4,500 PHP a month for a living. He requested a loan of 8,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer and maintain his farm. Efren has been a member of GDMPC just this year. In the future, Efren hopes to improve his farm for the better future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and maintain his farm.

loans.name: Santos Leonidas

texts.es: Santos, un joven de 29 años de edad, estudia la carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas, su mayor deseo es culminar sus estudios y poder ejercerla, en la actualidad trabaja como auxiliar contable con sus ingresos paga la mensualidad de la universidad y gastos de papelería. Solicita apoyo de crédito para poder ingresar al curso de titulación para obtener su título profesional, que le permitirá aspirar a un mejor empleo con el que podrá ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is a 29 year old young man who is studying Systems Engineering.  His greatest wish is to complete his studies and to be able to practice his career.

He currently works as an accounting assistant.  With his income he pays the monthly university fees and his paper and supply expenses.

He is requesting the support of a loan to be able to pay for his final degree course in order to get his professional degree.  This will allow him to aspire to a better job with which he will be able to help his family.

loans.use: to pay for his final degree course in order to get his professional degree.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 59 years old, married, and has thirteen children. They live in Masindi, Uganda. He is a farmer, and also earns a salary from teaching. Like most farmers, he is challenged by unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations that affect his growth. 

His dreams are to educate his children up to the university level, and to venture into modern commercial farming to earn extra income. Alfred intends to use this loan to pay workers who are plowing his land for the next season.

loans.use: to pay workers who are plowing his land for the next season

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of one child, Judith works hard to support her family. Judith buys and sells vegetables in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
Melina, a 43-year-old married mother of three, earns a living raising hogs in the Philippines. In this business for three years, she earns additional income running a general store.

Melina is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines and feeds for her pigs. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 57-year-old married man with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. He trades in produce and he has been in this business for three months. He started the business after realizing that farming alone was not enough for him to meet the daily expenses of his family. He hopes to buy a maize milling machine. However, the poor condition of the roads is a challenge. Robert intends to use the loan to pay for school fees and buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and to purchase cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
Tony is a 34-year-old widower with three children living in Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He owns and manages his farm, planting different kinds of plants such as banana, fruit trees and root crops. He's been in this business for 10 years and earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for a living.
 
He now requests a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2012, he joined GDMPC to have access to microfinance. In the future, he dreams to improve his farm.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: For more than two years, Vilma has been running a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people in her community of Bohol. Vilma is requesting a loan to buy more goods to sell such as canned goods, candies, snack foods, noodles and others. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell including canned goods, candies, snack foods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 21 years old and is married with one child. She runs a small business selling barbecue in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Mary has requested a loan to buy soy sauce, garlic, onions, rice, cucumbers, potatoes, chicken, mutton flaps, and sausages for her barbecue. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Mary will help provide for her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy soy sauce, garlic, onions, rice, cucumbers, potatoes, chicken, mutton, and sausages for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Clarita works hard to support her family. She has a lumber yard business in the Philippines, and also earns income from raising livestock.

Clarita, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF, is borrowing PHP 15000 to purchase more lumber to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell

loans.name: Raquel De Jesus

texts.es:
Raquel, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en el negocio de pupusas, este le ayudara a comprar todo lo necesario para la elaboración de pupusas tales como: aceite, tomates, repollos, quesillo, carnes, chicharrones, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le permitió aumentar su clientela y sus utilidades las invirtió en los gastos básicos del hogar; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y aumento un miembro en la familia.
texts.en:
Raquel is requesting a new loan because she needs to continue investing in her business selling pupusas [stuffed handmade corn tortillas]. This will help her to buy everything she needs for making pupusas, including the following: oil, tomatoes, cabbage, quesillo [a soft cheese], meat, chicharrones [seasoned, fried pork skin], and others.

The previous loan allowed her to increase her clientele. She invested the earnings in her basic household expenses. Her economic conditions have improved, and she added a new member to the family.

loans.use: to buy oil, tomatoes, cabbage, quesillo [a soft cheese], meat, chicharrones [seasoned fried pork skin], and other ingredients.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a single mother of one kid who attends school, and that is the reason for her hard work. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rental bills.

Lydia has operated a secondhand clothes business for the past five years. Her potential clients are both men and women. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny came to Accion Texas Inc. for the first time in 2008 when he was looking for capital to start his own business.  After 30-years as an employee in a similar line of business, Danny was ready to venture off on his own.  The first microloan he received helped him turn his dream into reality and S-N-S Flags, Inc. was created.  

When he launched his business, Danny’s clients consisted primarily of car dealerships around the San Antonio area.  He now sells flags to a variety of commercial clients, the most recent being McDonald’s. Danny sells the flags for the grand openings and other milestone celebrations for McDonald’s restaurants and hopes to take on more commercial contracts like this one in the future.

Since receiving his first loan from Accion, Danny has been able to gradually build his credit and grow his business assets.  Without the funds received from his most recent loan with Accion, Danny would not have been able to complete the repairs on his work vehicle, which would have crippled his ability to fulfill customer’s orders.  Danny also hopes to use the additional funds towards working capital.

loans.use: to repair his work vehicle

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a 55-year-old rice farmer from the municipality of Alicia, Bohol. She is married and has a daughter who is 16 years old. Her husband also works on the farm. This is their only source of livelihood. 

Antonia is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and insecticide to sustain her farm. A loan will be a great help since it will take another four months before she can reap the fruit of all their hard work. 

In the future, she hopes to have a good life from her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and insecticide.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is 32 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

Monaliza is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines and additional livestock. Monaliza has been raising livestock for three years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Monaliza would like to save enough money to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and additional livestock.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcyle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Vicenta has been in this business for two years. Vicenta earns additional income from a general store.

Vicenta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien, a widow, was born in 1958. She has three children. The oldest and middle children are married, and the youngest is a worker. She works as a farmer and sells vegetables in the market. She makes 2,000,000 VND each month from this business. Her family’s total earnings are about 4,000,000 VND per month.

Tien has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In the last cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to plant more vegetables. She hopes to save enough money to make repairs on her home.

loans.use: to plant more vegetables

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es: Maria de 34 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en casa de su propiedad y desde hace muchos años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maiz y frijol cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a las agencias de compra- venta de granos básicos con lo que ganancias que obtiene de  las ventas de sus  cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos y desea superarse haciendo lo mejor que puede en sus cultivos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en: María is 34 years old and lives with her husband and four children in their own home. For many years now she has worked in agriculture – growing corn and beans – which is her principal source of income. When her harvest is ready, she stores it in granaries as seen in the photograph, so that she can later sell it to wholesalers of basic grains. With the profits she earns from selling her harvests, she is able to pay for some of her family’s household expenses. She would like to buy the agricultural inputs she needs for her crops – such as manure, fertilizers and seeds – but because she does not have the economic resources to purchase them, she is requesting a loan, because that is the only way she can continue with her work. Like all others who live off the land, she places her confidence in her crops because she has no other source of income. She would like to get ahead doing the best she can with her crops. She hopes to have an abundant harvest that will permit her to continue to put food on her family’s table and to pay off this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, manure, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and pay workers who are preparing her garden.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a married woman who has been blessed with two children. Together with her husband, who is a businessman, they own a house that has electricity and piped water.

For three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future.

With this 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.en:
Feliciano worked for years in the historic Oak Cliff district of Dallas at Panaderia B, where he built a respected position in the local community by delighting locals with his savory Mexican bread through a recipe passed down by generations. Feliciano has always stated his emphasis is on quality, and for that reason, no modifications of his recipe are allowed.   

Feliciano first came to Accion Texas Inc. several years ago, and had such a good experience with his initial loan that he returned for working capital.  With a growing number of issues with his vision, securing the financial documentation for a loan can be a difficult process.  This was coupled with the fact that, as a traditionally cash-based business, evaluating the shop’s financial health was challenging.  

However, with the help of Accion staff as well as his loyal employees, Accion and Panaderia B were able to complete the process successfully. Today, Panaderia B is using Accion funds to make needed improvements to the store’s display fronts, help fund additional staff and employees, and serve as a fund for general capital. 

According to Feliciano, Accion and Panaderia B are likely to work again in the future for the benefit of his decade-old business.

loans.use: to make needed improvements to the store’s display fronts and help fund additional staff and employees

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 38-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two. 

Her husband owns a general store near his house, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of products in his store but would like to offer more variety to his customers. However, due to a lack of funds he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife Shazia has requested a loan of 45,000pkr from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so she can help her husband to purchase rusk, cake, biscuits, bread, bubbles, and popcorn. With the profit, her husband wants to grow his business. 

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase rusk, cake, biscuits, bread, bubbles, and popcorn to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 30 years old, married and has seven children.  

Carmelita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a new variety of rice seeds and to pay her laborers' salaries.

Carmelita has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of rice seeds and to pay her laborers' salaries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cloth for sewing

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 62 years old and is married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items to sell including canned goods, soap, shampoo, and noodles.

Florida has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for years and also earns an income from making candy and farming rice. She aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell including canned goods, soap, shampoo, and noodles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy Mobil oil for selling

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 29-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. She belongs to a poor family. They are going through a very difficult time, as the net income of her husband is not enough to sustain the family life. 

Her husband owns a general store near his house, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of products in his store. Presently, he is interested to offer more variety to his customers. However, due to the lack of finances, he finds it difficult. 

Therefore his wife, Nusrat, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase rusk, cake, biscuits, bread, bubbles, and popcorn to sell. This will help him to increase his net income and savings as well.

With the profit amount, Nusrat wants to construct her house. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to sell in the general store.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 32 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Jasmin is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jasmin has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.


Merly is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.


Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Saralyn

texts.en:
Saralyn is 35 years old and married with five children.
She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Saralyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.
Saralyn has been farming rice for 6 years and also earns additional income from fishing.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana is a 48-year-old rice farmer from the town of Mabini, Bohol. She is married and has six children between the ages of 16 and 24. Aside from farming rice, Cipriana is also engaged in raising hogs for a living. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy hog feed. This will assure healthy growth of her animals and a better income in four months. Her income will provide food and school fees for her children this coming school year.

In the future, she hopes to keep her business or make it even bigger.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Tanveer's Group

texts.en: Tanveer is a 39-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 5 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. From the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly and because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Tanveer, as a member of a 3 person group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Tanveer is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of dried fish to sell.
Susan has been in this business for 22 years. Susan earns additional income from a general store.
Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Bricelda

texts.es:
Bricelda es una mujer con 38 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante casada y madre de 2 hijos los cuales son apoyo con las diferentes actividades en el campo como ser: limpieza, corte, abono y fertilización de cultivos de café. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo pero no pudo continuar estudiando debido a que sus padres eran de bajos recursos económicos y no pudieron ayudar con sus estudios. Desde su niñez se ha  dedicado al cultivo de café actividad practicada por su familia hasta hoy en día siendo este el único sustento ya que fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra hace muchos años. La tierra que juntos en familia trabajan fue heredada por sus padres hace un tiempo para el sustento y cubrir gastos como la alimentación, vestimenta, estudio, medicinas, etc. y la otra parte fue comprada gracias al esfuerzo impuesto por ellos mismos a la cual se trasportan en vestía diariamente a una distancia de 3 kilómetros de su casa de habitación. 

 Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café esto para que sea una cosecha sana y provechosa para poder generar ingresos, obtener ganancias y poder seguir invirtiendo en la misma.

Sus metas son poder cultivar más plantas para de esa forma poder generar más ingresos para su familia ya que por medio de esto ellos podrán seguir invirtiendo en sus cultivos y agrandar poco a poco sus cosechas. Las ganancias son para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos y para seguir invirtiendo en su tierra.
texts.en:
Bricelda is a 38-year-old woman who is hardworking, enterprising, and has great desires to get ahead and progress.  She is married and has 2 children who help with different jobs in the fields, including general maintenance, cutting, and fertilizing the coffee crop.

She has completed one grade of primary school but was unable to continue her schooling because her parents didn't have much money and couldn't help her with her studies.  She has worked farming coffee since her childhood and her family continues to do it to this day.  This is their only means of obtaining income, since her parents (who taught her to work the land many years ago) have passed away.  The land that they farm together was inherited from her parents some time ago.  They farm it to cover bills such as food, clothing, education, medicine, etc.  The other piece of land that they own was bought, thanks to their own efforts.  They ride there (3 kilometers from home) every day.

She is asking for help to buy fertilizer and manure to help maintain her crop so they can have a good harvest that will give them income and help them continue to invest in it.  Her goals include being able to grow more plants so that she can get more income for her family.  In this way, they will be able to continue investing in their crops and increase their harvest little by little.  The profits are to secure a future for her children and to continue investing in her land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure to help maintain her coffee crop.

loans.name: Felix Santos

texts.es:
Felix tiene 47 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, caracterizada por su clima cálido, sus playas hermosas y la alegría de sus pobladores. Felix vive al lado de su esposa y de su único hijo, y cada día el se levanta muy temprano para ir a trabajar, y poder sacar a su familia adelante y sobre todo para brindarle todo su amor y comprensión.
Desde muy temprano Felix trabaja en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar; el cree que está saliendo adelante porque es  responsable y siempre su esposa esta a su lado para animarlo.

Felix está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, atún, entre otros para iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ya que en su barrio no hay, y de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Felix is 47 years old. He lives in the city of Pisco, known for its warm climate, its beautiful beaches, and the happiness of its people. Felix lives alongside his wife and their only son; every day he gets up very early to go to work to provide for his family and, above all, to give them all of his love and understanding.

From a very young age, Felix has worked at a farm in his city. He works around nine hours a day, and with the fruits of that labor, he is able to cover his household costs. He believes that he is able to make a living because he is responsible and because his wife is always at his side to encourage him. 

Felix is very grateful to the Kiva lenders; thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to purchase merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, tuna, and other items so that he can start a small business selling groceries, as there is no such shop in his neighborhood. In this way, he will be able to improve his income and continue striving to make his greatest dream a reality: to enable his son to have a professional career.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (rice, sugar, noodles, tuna, and other items)

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
Cesar, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo más en el negocio y así obtener mayores ingresos; este le permitirá comprar productos básicos tales como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, entre otros y productos plásticos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a crecer en el negocio y tener todo lo necesario para trabajar en la tienda; las condiciones económicas se han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado, ya que tienen una mejora calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar is asking for a new loan due to the need to continue to invest in his business and obtain more income.  This will allow him to buy basic goods such as rice, sugar, oil, beans, plastic goods, and other things.  His previous loan helped him to grow his business and have everything he needs to work in his store.

His financial situation and family circumstances have improved and they have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, plastic goods, and other things.

loans.name: Amgalanbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Amgalanbaatar is a 54-year-old retired man who lives with his wife, Basbish, his son, daughter-in-law and grandchild in a house in the Orhon province of Mongolia. Ms. Basbish is having health problems and stays home. His daughter-in-law has just given birth to a child and stays home. His son, Gantomor, is 26 years old and graduated from a wooden furniture manufacturing course. He is now starting his own business with his father on their plot of land. 

Mr. Amgalanbaatar and his son produced small furniture at home by order from time to time since 2007. Mr. Amgalanbaatar is now requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase construction materials to build a workplace on their plot of land to start a family business of wooden furniture manufacturing with his son. He is a hardworking, diligent and enthusiastic man.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a workplace on their plot of land to start a family business of wooden furniture manufacturing with his son.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 48 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Ofelia has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. Ofelia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Alcita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Alcita works hard to support her family.

She has a banana business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Alcita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell.

Alcita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 30-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, and because of this he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. 

Therefore, Shakeela has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Shakeela is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma works hard to support her family. Delma is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Delma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional cloth, needles, a sewing machine and other materials used in her business.

Delma has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Delma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cloth, needles, a sewing machine and other materials used in her business

loans.name: Maximina

texts.en:
Maximina is 66 years old, married, and has eight children.  

Maximina runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to restock her store with food and household goods to sell, including soap, sugar, milk, noodles, eggs, and canned goods. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Maximina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with food and household goods to sell, including soap, sugar, milk, noodles, eggs, and canned goods

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.en:
Eleuterio is a 69-year-old man from the town of CPG, Bohol. He owns a sari-sari store and his wife farms rice. For 30 years, he has been selling basic household commodities in his neighborhood for an income. In his store, he sells items like coffee, shampoo, cooking oil, soap, sugar and soft drinks. He is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy rice, soft drinks and canned goods.
This will boost his daily sales once his inventory is increased.
In the future, he hopes to maintain his business and make his store even bigger.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks and canned goods for his sari-sari store.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en: Erna is 50 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Erna earns additional income from selling feed and selling livestock. Erna is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed to sell. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed to sell

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is from the town of Ubay, Bohol. He is married with three children who range in age from 8 to 13 years old. Joel drives his motorcycle known as a habal-habal to offer transportation services in his neighborhood. This has been his business for three years. He is asking for a loan of 5000 PHP to buy a piglet and feed to help him earn additional income.
Joel hopes that he can improve the life of his family with these business ventures and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a piglet and feed.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is a 30-year-old married woman with 4 children. She makes and sells BBQ in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Elsie needs a loan to buy boxes of mutton flaps, sausages, chicken, soy-sauce and gas for the oven. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Elsie has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy boxes of mutton flaps, sausages, chicken, soy-sauce and gas for the oven.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Lilia has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn owns a bakery. She is 23 years old and from Mabini, Bohol. She is married with a 2-year-old daughter to support with her business. Her husband works as the baker, while she helps around as the partner of their business. Their bakery started two years ago and brings in 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) income per month for the family. In addition to her bakery, she also raises hogs for a living. 

Jenelyn is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed, flour and cornstarch to sustain her businesses. In the future, she hopes to make her business bigger so she can provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, flour and cornstarch

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 29-year-old woman who is married with four children. She runs a canteen business in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Maria has requested a loan to buy a box of noodles, a box of beewee snacks, bread, a box of tuna tins, fish, mayonnaise and ice cream. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy a box of noodles, a box of beewee snacks, bread, a box of tuna tins, fish, mayonnaise and ice cream

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 45-year-old married Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and four children who are still attending school. Ali owns a mini-market, and he has reached an advanced level of gaining a great number of loyal customers. 

Ali works really hard since he’s the main income provider for his family and has to pay his children’s study fees. For this reason he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to be able to improve his work by purchasing merchandise to add to his inventory. This will enable him to earn higher revenues. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans with the ambition to open his own supermarket.

loans.use: to be able to improve his work by purchasing additional inventory items

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 52 years old. She live in Ubay, Bohol with her family. She is married and has six children between the ages of 17 and 33. She has been raising hogs for 20 years now, while her husband mostly does farming for a living. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more piglets to raise, as well as feed to nourish them. She wants to assure healthy growth of her pigs. Her income will be used for family consumption and school fees for her children.

In the future, she would like to have a bigger piggery and successfully send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dairy cow.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to purchase more items to sell, like blouses, pants, slippers and other clothing. Generosa successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan, to further build her business. NWTF is listing Generosa's business profile again, in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like blouses, pants, slippers and other clothing

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su madre y su sobrina, es una mujer luchadora y responsable para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela fija pues da a un buen precio el plato de comida, la clienta desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar más materia prima como: pollos, carnes, arroz, frijoles, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar lo dicho; y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo necesario sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The borrower lives with her mother and her niece.  She is a hardworking, responsible mother so her family never lacks what they need to get by.  She currently works selling food near where she lives and has been doing it for several years.  She has many customers because she gives a good price for a plate of food.  

Her customers want her to expand her business and buy more goods, including chicken, meat, rice, beans, vegetables, etc.  By doing so, her menu will have more variety and she can have more income.  However, she doesn't have enough funds to make this investment.

For this reason, she is asking for a loan to buy these things and in this way obtain more profits that she can use to give her family what they need without limitation.

loans.use: buy chicken, meat, rice, beans, vegetables, and other goods wholesale.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar has more than 12 years of experience as the owner of Your Store Rent-To-Own.  His experience came from working many years at a local furniture renting company in Del Rio as a sales associate but eventually received a promotion to store manager.

Currently, Oscar’s wife operates the store during the day and he joins her evenings and weekends after he completes his shift at Ram Country Toyota where he is employed full-time as a sales associate.  Oscar continues to work full-time at Toyota to provide for his family and the new business.

Your Store Rent-To-Own offers customers the flexibility to rent furniture, electronics, and appliances at low prices with the option to purchase.  The store also offers great customer service and high quality products for their customers.  Oscar and his family enjoy giving the opportunity to his community the chance to buy a wide array of quality home furnishings.  

Oscar was referred to Accion Texas Inc. by the Small Business Development Center in Del Rio to inquire about applying for a loan.  Once Oscar received his loan, he was able to purchase more furniture pieces and electronic devices to rent to customers.  In the near future, Oscar plans to continue to build his inventory and hire additional employees as his business grows.

loans.use: to purchase more furniture and electronic devices to rent to customers

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 60 years old and is married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock including canned goods, milk, coffee, laundry soap, noodles, and other grocery items to sell in her general store.

Cristita has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, milk, coffee, laundry soap, noodles and other groceries. 

Cristita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock including canned goods, milk, coffee, laundry soap, noodles, and other grocery items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 49 years old and is married with six children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

Lolita has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from farming coconut.

She is working tirelessly toward the realization of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory is 49 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Lory is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lory has been farming sugarcane for 20 years and also earns additional income by direct-selling Avon products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a food vendor from the town of Loon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the business for more than 30 years now. She sells home-cooked snack foods to the people in her area. This is the source of her income. 

Jesusa is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for food vending like flour, refined sugar, milk, margarine, baking soda, cooking oil and other items. With the increase of ingredients, she will be able to cook and sell more, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Jesusa hopes to make her business sustainable and a success.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food vending like flour, refined sugar, milk, margarine, baking soda, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 46 years old and a widow with five children.

Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, and other items.

Melinda has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Melinda aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo for a livestock business

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a foo vendor from the town of Loon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has three school-aged children. 

Marife is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for food production like meat, vegetables, seasonings, and cooking oil. With this loan, she will be able to cook and sell more food to the people in her locality. In the future, Marife dreams of expanding her eatery/cafeteria so that she will be able to cater to more customers thus augmenting her profits and income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food production like meat, vegetables, seasonings, and cooking oil

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is a 36-year-old woman who has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for two years in Mabini, Bohol. She is married and has three children, ages 10, 13, and 15. She sell chips, condiments, sugar, coffee, soap, and detergent in her store. 

Ma. Cristina is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, detergent, shampoo, noodles, cooking oil, and rice. Her income will help her husband, who works in tailoring, in raising their family. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger store and other business options for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergent, shampoo, noodles, cooking oil, and rice

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a charcoal selling business in the Philippines. Nilda has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from farming rice and selling food.

Nilda requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses. In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Tafa

texts.en:
Tafa is 47 years old and married with 11 children. She has a small garden where she grows tomatoes, green peppers, cucumbers, pumpkins, and cabbages that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. 

Tafa needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a wheelbarrow, a rake, nails, barbed wire, and fertilizer for her garden. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Tafa will use the profits from her sales to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a wheelbarrow, a rake, nails, barbed wire, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 30 years old and married with two children who are both in school. Jacqueline works very hard to provide for them.

Jacqueline runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jacqueline has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Jacqueline would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Damaris Marbeli

texts.es: La señora Damaris habita en el Municipio de Ticuantepe, ella junto a su esposo e hijos se ha esforzado mucho para salir adelante y tener mejores condiciones de vida, con este nuevo financiamiento podra repellar su casa y realizar un embaldozado para que las lluvias no perjudiquen mas su casa ell aocmpra los siguientes materiales: Hierro, Cemento, Arena, Piedrin, Tablas etc, ella labora Docente en un centro educativo y su dificultad es no recoger de una sola vez el dinero necesario para contruir su casa, Gracias a Afodenic y Fondo Kiva por ayudarla a cumplir su sueño y el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Damaris lives in the city of Ticuantepe.  Together with her husband and children, she has put forth great effort to get ahead and obtain a better quality of life.  With this new loan, she will be able to stucco her house and roof it so the rain won't harm her house anymore.  She will buy the following materials: rebar, cement, sand, gravel, tiles, etc.

She works as a teacher at a school and it's difficult for her to save enough money to build her house all at once.  She thanks Afodenic and Kiva funds for helping her to fulfill her dream and that of her children.

loans.use: buy construction materials.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio de 41 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco y tiene un carisma muy contagiante. Gregorio desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y por ello tuvo la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven. 

Cada día Gregorio se levanta muy temprano para ir a su trabajo, el labora como obrero agrícola en un fundo de su ciudad y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar; él cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo trabajador.

Gregorio está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción como arena, fierro, ladrillos, entre otros; ya que podrá realizar el cercado de su vivienda,  así tendrá mas seguridad y su familia mejorara su calidad de vida, lo que le permitirá luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 41 years old and lives in the city of Pisco. He has a contagious charisma. From an early age he learned how to support himself with his own hard work, since his parents had few economic resources.

Each day Gregorio rises very early to go to work. He works as an agricultural worker for an agricultural holding in his city. With what he earns from his work, he is able to pay his household expenses. He believes that he is getting ahead because he is responsible, and above all, hardworking.

Gregorio is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the support they give him, he will be able to buy construction materials such as sand, iron and bricks, among others. With these he will be able to finish the peripheral wall that surrounds his home, and therefore provide more security and a better quality of life to his family. This will also allow him to continue striving for his greatest dream, which is to finish the construction of his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, iron and bricks, among others.

loans.name: Elqui Ismael

texts.es:
Elqui es un joven de 23 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Guadalupe, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, limón, entre otros productos.
