Liezyl is a married woman and has three children. Liezyl is 21 years old and resides in Tabuan, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of food products to earn a living and she's been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 6,500 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 8,200 PHP to buy ingredients and utensils needed. 

In 2008, Liezyl joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Liezyl wants to build a house and for her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils needed

loans.name: Diana's Group

texts.en:
Diana's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Diana is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is Married and has 2 children who are currently in school. For the past 4 years, Diana has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Diana has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for sale, and will help Diana to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Diana hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Diana is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 36 years old. He lives in Telavi district with his wife, Nunu, his retired father and retired aunt. George requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions.

George is a professional singer. He is singing at the local restaurant for private parties, and he gets a small income. His wife, Nunu, is a music teacher at the local school. The family gets additional income from George’s father’s and aunt’s monthly pensions.

George requested loan from Credo to start up family business. George has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up Loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credit, with soft conditions, to rural poor people, who do not have access to other credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit George will open a bakery and make Georgian bread. He has a space in his garden, and he wants to renovate it, purchase all the needed equipment, and start baking bread there. The bread will be sold from the bakery. This business is popular in his district, and he hopes it will be successful. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up Loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To open a bakery and make Georgian bread.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Don antonio de 46  años de edad, se dedica desde hace muchos años a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz y frijol, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y sus 5  hijos. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, que es su principal fuente de ingresos.  Con muchos deseos de superación decidió solicitar un crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc.  para la siembra. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá tener  una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio is 46 years old, and for many years has worked cultivating the land. With much dedication he cultivates corn and beans, which allows him to support his family every day at home. He is characterized as being a hard-working, honest, and responsible man. He lives with his family which is made of his wife and their 5 children. He and his wife work very hard to move their family forward. Thanks to his knowledge of agriculture, he achieves bringing support to his home, which is their principle source of income. 

With much desire of overcoming, he decided to request a loan, given that he needs to invest in the purchase of the necessary agricultural supplies: seeds, compost, insecticides, etc for the sowing. He trusts in God and in his work, and in this way he will achieve an abundant harvest which will allow him to have a better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
This is Maricris, 42, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Federico, a candle vendor, and mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. She continually works hard, to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maricris operates a retail business, where she sells products such as steel wool, razors, acetone, and more. She gets these products from a wholesaler, who gives her a cheaper price. Her customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales, every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more inventory, including steel wool, razors, acetone and other products. 

Maricris dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that she will have more sources of income. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more inventory, including steel wool, razors, acetone and other products.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 50 years old, married, and has five children. With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Adelaida has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, basic groceries, and soap.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional items to resell at the store, like snack foods, cooking oil, soft drinks, laundry soap, and sugar. In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to resell at the store, like snack foods, cooking oil, soft drinks, laundry soap, and sugar.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 19 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past three years, Mary has been working hard to manage her soft drink business, which sells local juice. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 450,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fruits that will be used to make the local juice, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and take good care of herself and her family. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to increase the capital in her business. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to make the local juice

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Herbert is a 30-year-old hardworking-honest married man blessed with 2 children and live in Fort portal,Uganda. He is a teacher by profession but also operates a retail shop in order to meet his family's daily expenses. He was inspired to the profession because it is permanent and pensionable by government. Low salary and price fluctuation are his hardships while his dream is to become a school headmaster. Herbert intends to use the loan to buy land for farming and general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy land for farming and general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 53-year-old woman from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. She is married with eight children. Teresita has been in the business of weaving mats to earn a living for her family since 2008. 

She is asking for a loan to buy buri leaves and dye for her mat weaving. Her income will take care of food and some school fees of her children. She hopes that she can do more for her business so she can provide better for her family. 

In the future, she hopes to have a better chance of venturing into other business for an increased income.

loans.use: to buy dye and buri leaves

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a fish vendor from the town of Lila, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. Flora has been engaged in the fish vending business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Flora is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. Through this inventory increase, she will be able to sell more fish, which gives her the chance of augmenting her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Manuel Horacio

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 30 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Manuel pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Electricidad que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Manuel trabaja como técnico en una empresa de transporte de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días realizando labores de instalación y mantenimiento eléctrico de unidades móviles, Manuel puede trabajar por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Manuel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar materiales de construcción y cubrir los gastos de mano de obra para avanzar con la construcción de una habitación, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda segura y adecuada.
texts.en:
Manuel is a man of 30. He lives in the city of Chiclayo, in the district of Guadalupe. He is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to achieve. Thanks to his efforts and the support of his parents, Manuel was able to study the technical program in electricity that he wanted. In his free time he likes to play soccer, and sometimes he cooks a very delicious pasta dish to share with his family.

On his own initiative, and with great effort and dedication, Manuel works as a technician in a transportation business in his city. He works every day, doing electrical installation and maintenance work on vehicles. Manuel can work for about 10 hours and believes that it is going well for him because of his good performance and because of his friendly dealings with others.

Manuel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered he will be able to complete the improvement of his home, since he wants to buy construction materials and cover the costs of labor to progress with the construction of a room. Thus he will continue working and striving to achieve his great dream of having a safe and proper house.

loans.use: to make improvements on his house

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es: José de 47 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 20 años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde siembra esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio; en las ultimas cosechas tuvo muchos problemas y perdidas y desea recuperarse, hará una nueva inversión que le permita aumentar la producción por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herramientas, etc. José tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old and lives with his life companion and their two children. He cultivates corn and beans, has been working in agriculture for 20 years, and has earned valuable experience which allows him to obtain the best crops. 

The land where he sows is located in a place of high agricultural impact and is very close to his home. He sells his harvest in all of the close areas in his community, and he has earned many customers who prefer his crops because everything that he sells is top-quality, at accessible prices, and with good service. In recent harvests, he had many problems and losses and he wishes to recover.

He will make a new investment which will allow him to increase his production. For that reason, he is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy corn seeds, beans, compost, insecticides, tools, etc. José has good references for payment and assures that he will be able to settle the loan and at the same time he has hope that he will bring economic security to his home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, etc.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en: Nasreen is a 51-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. She is a responsible mother of 6-children. She belongs to a poor family. Her husband is a carpenter and his income is insufficient to sustain his family. He is in need of purchasing wood for making furniture. For that reason, his wife Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase wood for making furniture such as chairs, tables, and sofas to sell. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy wood for her husband for making furniture.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are currently both in school. For the past two years, Doreen has been working hard to manage her small knitting business, which makes knit sweaters. 

To help expand her business, Doreen has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more thread to knit sweaters to sell, and will help Doreen to generate greater profits and improve on her family's standard of living. Doreen hopes that in the future she will become a very rich businesswoman in town and also start supplying schools with sweaters. 

Doreen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more thread to knit sweaters to sell

loans.name: Zaitun

texts.en:
Zaitun is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, 1 of whom is currently in school. For the past 3 years, Zaitun has been working hard to manage her small shop that sells fast foods.

To help expand her business, Zaitun has requested a loan of 500000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more Irish potatoes and food to sell. This will help Zaitun to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Zaitun hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her family's standards of living. 

Zaitun is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more Irish potatoes and food to sell.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque necesita capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de granos básicos; este le permitirá comprar abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a adquirir los insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Orlando is applying for a new loan because he needs working capital to continue investing in the cultivation of basic crops. This will allow him to buy compost, insecticides, and pesticides, among other items.

The previous loan helped him to acquire agricultural supplies for growing corn and beans. The economic conditions and circumstances of his family have improved.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, and pesticides, among other items.

loans.name: Dinar

texts.ru:
Динар  58 лет. Динар работает почтальоном и в качестве дополнительного  дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав с  покупки 10 овец. Благодаря упорному труду Динар в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 головы крупного рогатого скота с приплодом, 50 голов мелкого скота и земля  с посевом фасоли и многолетних трав.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Динар обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки крупного рогатого скота и ядохимикатов для удобрения земли.  Доходы от кредита Динар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а  в будущем  хотела бы дать достойное образование внуку.
texts.en:
Dinar is 58 years old. She works as a mail carrier and, as an additional source of income for her family, also raises livestock. She launched this business by buying 10 sheep. Thanks to Dinar’s hard work, her farm now includes three heads of cattle with their young, 50 heads of small livestock and a field where she grows beans and perennial grasses. 

In order to develop her business further, Dinar has applied to the “Bai Tushum & Partners” microfinance bank for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS intended for increasing her livestock by purchasing additional cattle as well as for buying chemical fertilizers. Dinar plans to use her revenues into a further increase of livestock, and in the future she would like to provide for a decent education for her grandson.

loans.use: to purchase cattle as well as fertilizers for her land.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
My name is Maureen. I'm pursuing a Bachelor of Commerce degree at Strathmore University. I will be in my third year in July 2013. I am the second born in a family of three children. We were raised by a single mother, who is now deceased; my elder brother is the one who meets our day-to-day expenses.

As a student, a laptop will be very necessary as it will aid in doing academic research and assignments. I therefore request a Kiva loan to help me buy the laptop. The loan will be serviced by my brother.

I would be delighted to join Campus Kiva while at Strathmore University, in order to give back to Kiva and society. In the future, when I graduate and get a job, I will be delighted to join Kiva and lend to others.

loans.use: to buy a laptop which will help her conduct her academic research and complete her assignments on time.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers.

Michelle successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Michelle's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past year, Margret has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells smalll silver fish. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sacks of silver fish to sell, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for her self and her child. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business and become the main supplier in town. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy sacks of silver fish to sell

loans.name: Venus

texts.en: Venus is a married woman and has six children. Venus is 39 years old and resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines.  She is operating a fishing business venture, selling seafood products including crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living and she's been in the business for 13 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. In 2008, Venus joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Venus hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Alice, 44 years old, lives in Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married with two kids. She opened a grocery store five years ago and earns 2,800 PHP a month. 

Now she needs to increase her stock, so she decided to ask for a microcredit from GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 3,400 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She hopes in this way she will develop her business to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Luz Clarita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ CLARITA” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, costura de chamarras, venta de mochilas, hilado y venta de lana de vicuña, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa al ver la necesidad que existía de sus vecinos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de enlatados, arroz, fideo, etc.) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Luz Clarita" will begin its seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch regional center. The group consists of eight members and is led by a board of directors, of which Señora Virginia is the president. The businesses of the members of the group are varied, and among them are weaving blankets, neighborhood store, selling food, making jackets, selling backpacks, spinning and selling vicuña wool, and selling vegetables.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these little microbusinesswomen, of whom Señora Virginia is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer six months ago at the invitation of a friend from the institution. Now she has a business, a neighborhood store. She makes it known that she began this business on seeing the need that existed among her neighbors.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital  by buying canned goods, rice, noodles, etc., which she will acquire from the distributing stores in the city of El Alto, and then she will sell them in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible, since she lives in a free union relationship and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the meetings and the training.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, rice, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en: Ameen is a simple, honest, and very hardworking person. He's 32 years old and comes from a humble family from Sana`a, Yemen. He is married, has 3 children and faces difficult financial challenges. He is a teacher getting a low salary and it is not enough to cover his family's expenses. He accummulated a small amount of money to buy a taxi, so he applied for a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB to cover the purchasing of the taxi to help him provide for his family's expenses. He hopes to improve his living standards and enroll his children in private school.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi to provide for his family's expenses

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 33-year-old woman and married Hamsyah, a 39 year old man. They are blessed with four children: Alfiani, 15, 1st grade of Senior High School; Alfian, 13, 1st grade of Junior High School, Syahrul, 9, 3rd grade of Elementary School; and Nayla, 6.

Fatima is running a kiosk business selling bath soap, detergent, stationery, candies and snacks, etc. With this business she aims to assist her husband in generating more income for her family. She started the business by using her own capital. Fatima has planned to sell second hand clothing in the market. Fatima then requested a loan of  4,500,000 IDR from Tanaoba Lais Manekat Foundation (TLM). She believes the business will give benefits for her family

loans.use: to purchase second hand clothing

loans.name: Phiona's Group

texts.en:
Phiona's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Phiona is 19 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two years, Phiona has been working hard to manage her small business, through which she sells fresh fruit. 

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fresh fruit to sell, and will help Phiona to generate greater profits and take care of her child and her family. Phiona hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her capital in her business. 

Phiona is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fruit to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39-year-old Janet from Bulawayo. She is divorced and has one child.  Janet runs a retail business selling clothes, shoes, night dresses and fashion shoes. The business has been in operation for 3 years. She says the main challenges faced are lack of working capital. Janet has requested a loan of $500.00 to stock up for the winter season. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to supplement her other sewing business and help pay school fees for her child. In the future Janet plans to increase business capacity by opening up a clothing boutique in town.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell for the winter season

loans.name: Mercury

texts.en: Mercury is 39 years old and married; she lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, with her two children. She earns an income from her transport service business. She started it almost two years ago and she earns 4,000 PHP a month. To improve her business, she is borrowing the amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, which she joined five years ago. She will use the loan to repair her bicycle to provide better service. She is hopeful that she will be able to purchase another bicycle before long to expand her transport service.

loans.use: To repair her bicycle to provide better service

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To repair the overlock machine

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 30-years-old, married, and has five children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Karen has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Karen requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell.

Karen has been in this business for 20 years. Karen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Panglao, Bohol. She has been involved in a food vending business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Jessica is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for food production and vending like vegetables, meat, seasonings, and cooking oil. Through this loan, she will be able to cook more and sell more thus increasing her sales and income. In the future, Jessica dreams of making her business a success and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food vending like vegetables, meat, seasonings, and cooking oil

loans.name: Margret's Group

texts.en:
Margret's group is comprised of thee hard-working women. Margret is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Margret has been working hard to manage her handcraft business, through which sells handcrafted items. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more materials for making crafts to sell and will help Margret to generate greater profits and take good care of her sickly mother. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business and own a small shop in which to sell her crafts, since she currently sells them on the verandah. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for making crafts to sell

loans.name: Kumboedza Chinembiri Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 36-year-old Moasi from Masvingo. Moasi is a single parent with three children; two are attending school. Moasi runs a retail business which sells groceries. The business has been in operation for one year now. She says the main challenge she faces is costs for transporting stock from the wholesaler to her shop. 

Moasi has requested a loan of $300 to buy groceries for restocking. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future Moasi plans to own a big shop.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
This is Shirley, 43, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Chito, a plumber, and is mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Shirley operates a retail business where she sells different products like acetone, cuticle remover, glue, needles and more. She gets these products from a wholesaler where she is given cheaper prices. Her customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of acetone, cuticle remover, glue, needles and other products.

Shirley dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will have jobs. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stocks of acetone, cuticle remover, needles, glue and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mlimani Group

texts.en:
Said, who is in his mid 30s is married with three children, one son and two daughters. All of them are still going to school. He has had a retail shop for two years. He works from 6.00 am to 9.00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Said's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants to use to start selling cosmetics. He will continue to increase the inventory of his retail shop. His dream is to build his own house.

Said will share this loan with his loan group "Mlimani" which has eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling cosmetics.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre de 24 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Jorge no pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de manejo de maquinaria pesada que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta bailar y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jorge trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen trato y porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Jorge se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y el mantenimiento general que necesita su mototaxi, de esta manera Jorge tendrá su herramienta de trabajo en mejores condiciones y podrá seguir trabajando, así pues él desea lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una carrera profesional para pode encontrar un mejor trabajo.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 24-year-old man. He is single and lives in the city of Pisco with his parents and siblings. He is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a strong desire to better himself. Unfortunately, because of his lack of economic resources and the need to work from a very young age to help his parents, Jorge was not able to pursue the technical degree in equipment operation that he wanted. In his free moments, he likes to dance and, on occasion, cook a delicious "carapulcra con sopa seca" [a traditional Andean dish] to share with his family.

With a great deal of effort and dedication, Jorge works on his own as a mototaxi driver, providing transportation services in his city. He works every day for approximately twelve hours, and he believes that it's going well for him because of his courteous manner and because he knows the zones where he can find the greatest quantities of passengers.

Jorge is very grateful to the Kiva lenders; thanks to the help given, he will be able to do the refurbishment and general maintenance that his mototaxi needs. This will allow Jorge to have his work equipment in better condition and continue working. He also wants to achieve his big dream of earning a professional degree so that he will be able to find a better job.

loans.use: to refurbish and perform maintenance on his mototaxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is a married woman from the town of Albur, Bohol. She is engaged in a business making and vending kalamay, a sticky sweet delicacy that is popular in many regions of the Philippines. It is made of coconut milk, brown sugar, and ground glutinous rice (Wikipedia). 
Severina is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for making kalamay including glutinous rice, sugar and peanuts. With this loan, she will be able to cook and sell more kalamay, thus augmenting her earnings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making kalamay including glutinous rice, sugar and peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy kapenta (fish), beans and rice

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a hard-working married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He a teacher by profession and has been a teacher for 16 years. With the salary savings, he has been able to buy land and start construction of his residential house despite challenges of inadequate capital. He is determined to change his future and that of his children through education while his business plans are to set up a retail shop to meet his family's daily expenses. Robert intends to use the loan to buy construction materials such as iron sheets and bricks to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as iron sheets and bricks to complete his house.

loans.name: Zebar

texts.en: Zebar is 59 years old. She is married and has seven children who are adults. She is a great mother. She always wanted to provide her children with a good quality of life. She has been busy with sewing and selling the national mattress called kurpacha, but her income from this business is small and that’s why she decided to organize a new business. She studied at the course called "To Get Ahead" in the women's organization and got enough skills about business. Her son will help her with the business. She is asking for a loan to buy cattle for organizing a new business. She will get through using the loan, and her business will grow to be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 46-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with her family. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver, which is the only source of income for his family. For the past many days, he has been unable to generate any amount of income because of the bad condition of the rickshaw. Fatima wants to help her husband; therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. The loan amount will help her husband to purchase a front screen and other spare parts to improve its condition to start his work again. 

Fatima is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a front screen and spare parts to repair a rickshaw.

loans.name: Shena

texts.en: Shena is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of one child from Corella, Bohol. She has been engaged in a charcoal-making business for more than three years now. Shena is asking for a loan to buy more wood and coconut shells for charcoal making. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her business and income.

loans.use: to buy more wood and coconut shells for charcoal making.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 16 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past one year, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her handicraft business, in which she sells handcrafted items. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more material that will be used to make crafts for selling, and will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and take good care of herself. Beatrice hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand into a craft mall. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more material that will be used to make crafts to sell.

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine's group is composed of two hard-working women. Justine is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one currently in school. For the past two years, Justine has been working hard to manage her small fish business. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more dried fish to sell, and will help Justine generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself and her children. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her capital in her business. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell,

loans.name: Kubatana Dangamvura Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39-year-old Tracy from Mutare. Tracy is married with two children, both attending school. She also cares for three dependents. Tracy runs a retail business; she sells clothes, shoes and electrical gadgets. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenge being faced is of clients defaulting to pay after they buy on credit. 

Tracy has requested a loan of $1,200 to stock more products for her clients. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to improve the general family welfare. In the future, Tracy plans to have ownership of her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods and clothes to resell.

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en: Shamshad is a 46-year-old woman and a member of this two-person group. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. She is the mother of 4 children. Her husband owns an auto spare parts shop which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a variety of vehicle spare parts such as tyres, tubes, foot rests, wheels, and chains. For that reason Shamshad has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her husband to increase his income and offer a greater variety to his customers. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of auto spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Ngailut Group

texts.en:
They are called the “Ngailut” Group and they have been associated with WSDS since 2010. They are a group of six women from a tribal community and live in a very small and remote village in the state of Manipur, in the Northeastern part of India.

The profile representative of “Ngailut” Group is Nengneikim. She is the one on the extreme left of the picture with her right hand raised. She has two sons and one daughter and her husband is a daily wage earner whose income is not enough to meet the daily expenses of the family. Being a woman, she cannot do hard labor work so she weaves and, with the minimal sum of money she gets, she runs the house.  

She is an active member of the group and a very efficient, dedicated and hardworking woman. With the first loan from WSDS, she bought two piglets. After a year and half, they had grown to full size and were ready to be sold in the market. With the profit she earned, she could repay the loan on time and with the remaining, she was able to buy some other essential requirements for the family and some household items.

With this Kiva loan, she will buy four piglets and construct a bigger pigsty to set up a piggery farm in the future. She also said that she has a bigger dream of purchasing a mini van for public transportation, which she said will benefit the people in her village and the surrounding villages and at the same time she will also be able to benefit from it. In order to fulfill her dreams, she manages regular monthly savings from her profits in her new bank account. And she is hopeful that after five to seven years, she will have enough money to fulfill her dreams. 

She wants to thank Kiva and WSDS for the support they have rendered to her and to the group. The rest of the group members are engaged in weaving, tailoring, a piggery and other income-generating activities. She said that all of them are eagerly and patiently waiting for the Kiva loan.

loans.use: To purchase three more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is from Gtashen village in the Shirak region, where she lives with her husband, two sons, a daughter-in-law and little grandchildren. Hasmik and her whole family have been involved in agriculture for many years. They keep livestock (27, 85 sheep, 15 pigs and 20 chickens), cultivate barley and grow apple and pear trees. Hasmik, together with her daughter-in-law, milk cows and use the milk to produce cheese. Her husband and sons sell agricultural products locally. The farming business is very important to this family as it is the only source of their income. They all work hard to gather a good harvest and earn a high income.

The car, by which they are taking the harvest to the market, is very old and needs to be repaired. Unfortunately, Hasmik has no financial means to repair that car and time after time it is becoming difficult for the family to take the harvest to the market. 

So, Hasmik has requested a loan from SEF International to, first, repair the car and then expand the farm. With the loan's help, Hasmik will purchase potato and barley seeds and will pay fuel costs. Hasmik is sure that the loan will give them an opportunity to sustain their farm and earn a high enough income.

loans.use: to repair her car, to purchase potato and barley seeds and to cover fuel costs

loans.name: Sabahat's Group

texts.en:
Sabahat is 42 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband who works very hard so that the family can have a good and respectable life. Eight years ago, her husband started his own business of selling welding material. 

Sabahat is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of welding products including iron rods, iron sheet, soldering rods, and welding rods so he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Sabahat hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase iron rods, iron sheet, soldering rods, and welding rods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seedlings and clear land for planting.

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.en: A beautiful woman by the name of Mahfirat lives in a flat that is in bad condition. Her husband is a kind man who works in Russia and has a very small salary. They have one clever child. Mahfirat’s child wants to live in a house that is in good condition but her income from sewing is not enough to repair it. She must repair all her rooms including the kitchen, hall, living room and bedroom. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy building materials. In this way, she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month she will make her payment on time. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old. She lives at Paynesville North which is a larger local market in Montsorrade. She is married and her husband is currently unemployed. They have seven children, 20-24 years old, who are in school and live at home. 
Mary describes herself as a hardworking person. For the past ten years she has been selling oil, rice, pepper, etc in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways her customers respond to it. Mary started this business with money given to her by her mother. She gets her goods to market by using a shared taxi. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, etc for her business. 
In the future, Mary plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to thank the lenders who support BRAC Liberia in enabling small businesses to increase their sales volumes.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, etc  for her business,

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Esther is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling groceries in Besease (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. 
Esther is married and has 5 children. Her husband works as a famer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 
Esther wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries. In the long term, Esther plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the challenge of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y así obtener mayores ingresos económicos para el sustento de cada día; este le ayudara a comprar cien pollos, vitaminas, antibióticos para el cuidado de estos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar las utilidades,  aumentar las ventas y la clientela;  las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Miriam is requesting a new loan because she needs to continue investing in her business so that she can generate more income for daily needs. This loan will help her buy 100 chickens, vitamins, and antibiotics for their care.

Her previous loan helped to increase her profits, her sales, and her customer base. As a result, her financial condition and her family circumstances have been optimal.

loans.use: to buy 100 chickens, vitamins, and antibiotics.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 35-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband is the only person earning an income in the family. He delivers luggage, grass, and water by donkey cart. He values a donkey cart more than any other possession because it can make money for him to sustain his family life. He needs capital for the maintenance of his donkey cart. However, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. 

Therefore, his wife Parveen has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband. Her husband wants to purchase a vehicle to earn money instead of using the donkey cart. So with the profits, they will save to purchase a vehicle in the future. Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to maintain a donkey cart.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 41 años de edad es una mujer alegre y emprendedora. Tiene casa propia en donde vive junto a su esposo .El trabajo  de María consiste  en la venta de hojas secas de palemra el cual lleva el nombre de "shebon" el cual es usado como techo en distintas comunidades de su región. Realiza la venta de estas hojas en el frontis de su vivienda y lleva 4 años en este negocio. Antes de iniciar esta actividad económica  no tenía el capital suficiente para aperturar otro tipo de negocio propio por eso ayudaba a su esposo en la agricultura, hasta lograr tener un capital de respaldo.  Desea permanecer en este negocio  e incrementar sus ventas, extraer abundantes hojas para abastecer a sus clientes y generar más ganancias económicas.Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 05 con Kiva y está agradecida por la oportunidad de seguir adelante con su negocio.Con el monto solicitado de 2500 soles,comprará herramientas para la extracción de estas hojas tales como machetes, hachas, palas,entre otros.
texts.en:
María, 41, is a cheerful, enterprising woman who lives with her husband in her own house.  María earns a living selling dry palm leaves which are called "shebon" and used in differente communities in the region.  For four years she has been in business selling the leaves out in front of her house.

Before starting this activity she did not have enough capital to set up her own business so she helped her husband in agriculture until she was able to get economic support.  She wants to stay in business and increase sales by extracting greater quantities of leaves to supply to her customers.  This will generate more income.  This is her fifth loan through Kiva and she is grateful for the opportunity to continue prospering in her business.   The loan in the amount of 2,500 PEN will be used to buy leaf extraction tools such as machetes, axes, shovels, etc.

loans.use: To buy tools such as axes, machetes, shovels, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 62 years old. She lives in the small village of Ozurgeti District with her husband. They receive a retirement pension. Liana has requested loans  for a proposed family business start-up several times from local financial institutions, but without any success. Each loan request was rejected because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Liana has a plot of agricultural land where she grows nut trees and has a 0.5 hectare tea plantation. The family also owns a pig and piglets. Although Liana sells the harvested nuts and piglets at a good price, her profit is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Liana requested this loan from Credo for her start-up family business. Liana has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credit with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not usually have access to credit products. Such borrowers are regarded as “high risk" because of their low income. With this loan, Liana will purchase equipment for picking and drying tea. She will sell the produced tea at the local markets at a good price. This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase the tea equipment

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Veronica is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cosmetics in Besease (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 12 years. 
Veronica is married and has 2 children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 
Veronica will use this loan to purchase more cosmetics, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the profits from her expanded business, Veronica plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, helping her to improve her overall sales
